name: Elina
snippet: gorgeous hotel with lovely staff that are happy to help with anything and are very hospitable. Arrived at 12pm even though check in is at 4 and the room was ready which is always nice. This hotel has the comfiest beds I have ever slept in and its great that check out is later than other hotels. Breakfast buffet was great with a good variety. The pool and leisure amenities were great too. The lockers and showers could be improved but not a big deal. The hotel is really close to the bus and train station and the main areas of the city are a short walk away. Overall, Its really good value and perfect for a relaxing getaway.

name: Syl Murphy
snippet:
Fabulous hotel. Fantastic location. Staff, food, cleanliness, bedrooms were all excellent. Really enjoyed our 3 night stay there with our two young children. They really enjoyed the heated pool. Can't wait to go back again. Best hotel we've stayed at in Ireland.

Rooms: We had adjoining rooms for ourselves and our two children. So much space. Very clean and comfortable.

name: liz king
snippet:
My son treated me to a full body massage at the Galmont, Spirit Spa in Galway.
I was met at reception by the lovely Alana, who was super professional, friendly and efficient.
My therapist was a fantastic young lady named Simone, she asked how I liked my massage and I say good pressure, and wow, did she deliver!
It was the best massage I have ever had, she truly has magic hands and was so pleasant and professional at all times.
At the end of the appointment, I was given a bottle of water and told to stay well hydrated throughout the day.
I was then led to the relaxation room where I could have refreshments and just relax following my treatment.
The whole experience was first class and surpassed my expectations.
I will definitely be going back, well done to a fabulous team, and huge thanks to the very talented Simone.

name: Mo B
snippet:
Absolutely loved staying at the Galmont. The location is excellent being close to the train and bus stations. It's also close to Eyre Square and all of the coffee shops, restaurants and bars.
The quality of food was some of the best we have ever had. The breakfasts were amazing. We loved the waffles that our kind waiter Alejandro suggested to try. 10/10!!

name: Jordi COLL
snippet:
FANTASTIC ACCOMMODATION!

We have been there for 1 day and the truth is that we will return for sure!

Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and especially at dinner time Paula served us and she is fantastic!!!
She treated us very well from the first moment, she paid a lot of attention to us and she advised us on a duck that we loved!!!
Thank you Paula for making our stay great!

The rest of the staff was also very nice

name: Marcos Alvarez
snippet:
During my stay at Hotel Galmont, Juan's warm hospitality and attention to detail made me feel truly valued as a guest. The delightful breakfast he served, coupled with his friendly demeanor, elevated my overall experience. Highly commend Juan for his outstanding service and contribution to a memorable stay!   

Food & drinks: I was impressed by the cleanliness and presentation of the breakfast buffet.

name: Owen Corcoran
snippet: Great hotel, great location.  We have stayed many times but this time found the staff slightly distracted and took alot more time that needed to get served . Other than that a wonderful stay. Food and breakfast 10/10

name: Amber Brady
snippet:
We came to this hotel with a tour company. The lobby is so beautiful and welcoming.  However, the hotel is very large and oddly shaped and there are rooms in a 1200 & 1300 block that are quite hard to find and I got lost multiple times coming from or to these rooms. We also had several rooms where we found the beds were not up to hotel standards.  In the room I was in there were many long black hairs as though after making the bed someone laid down and relaxed. We also had several rooms that we had asked for double occupancy for multiple people to be in the room and we found the rooms to be 2 twin beds pushed together and even made a 1 bed with the sheets in 1 room. This is not that bad as we just moved the beds but we did give a list with the details and it seems going that extra mile would have been the difference.  There was also quite a bit of dust and spider webs in the stairwells.
The food was pretty good and you get plenty. Though our St Patrick's Day Cheesecake everyone had a different thickness in their Graham cavorting crust. And they did not seem to make their portions uniform in the main dishes.  Our first night's dinner the Roasted chicken dishes varied wildly from plate to plate in size.  Sorry no pivots as I didn't know everyone so I don't have the pictures of everyone's food.  But my chicken was the smallest one at the table everyone else was about 15-20% large pieces. I didn't have it but they said the Chocolate Mousse was wonderful!
For vending machines I earn you that the one in the 1200 block of the hotel will only take coins and no credit card or mobile payment.  The one buy the main elevator on the 1st floor had a mobile payment acceptance however was very empty and not working our first day there.
The service was good. When we asked for something they were quick to respond and get things for us and everyone was very nice.

Nearby activities: Walking disgrace to Eyre Square and many pubs.

name: Greg Gehringer
snippet: Great place to stay. The rooms are great including the Lakeview. Breakfast was fantastic and simple. Staff was amazing. The hotel is very close to downtown pubs and great restaurants. I highly recommend.

name: Andrew Katers
snippet: A good hotel in a perfect location. The only downside is the hotel bar - Coopers bar. Service here is well below average. It's like they try to do anything else but serve you. Especially the barman with a beard and tattoos. Watched him ignore patrons like it was his job. If you're worried about having too much to drink, come here. It'll never happen. Shame, as the rest of the hotel is very nice.

name: Gabriel Hernandez
snippet:
Stay was great. Everything was near the hotel. The spa was a nice treat. Our beds were so comfy, we slept really well. View was also nice. Only complaints is we never got to get into the Jacuzzi cause 4 people were hogging it up for almost an hour. We complained but nothing was done. Also we had a nasty rug stain and a piece of chocolate sitting by the bed. We purposely left it there to see if our rooms were properly cleaned. Yet every night the same sticky stain, and chocolate sat there. Despite asking to clean the room with a cleaning employee, the stain and chocolate remained. This did not affect our stay, everything else was pleasant, which is why I'm sticking with the 5 stars.

Rooms: Lacked cleanliness.

name: BL Clarkski
snippet: The nicest hotel we stayed at during our adventures in Ireland. The family room was so spacious - perfect for a family of four. The room was clean and well-appointed. The staff was so friendly and went out of their way to help us with anything we needed. The hotel is walking distance to so much in Galway. You really can't beat it. We look forward to staying here again.

name: Grá Ní Bhroin
snippet: Beautiful hotel, tasteful decor and a huge airy lobby. Breakfast was amazing , so much to choose from. Our waiter was so friendly and attentive. The rooms are basic , spacious and clean. The shower unreal. It's a shame that the door to the patio was kept locked because the view is nice and it would be lovely to sit and meditate for a while in the fresh sea air. Room services are not 4 star, basic kettle with Bewleys sachets kind of thing. The elmais products a nice touch though as is the water stations at the life with still, hot and sparkling options. Great location only a short walk to the centre.

name: Eve O' Dwyer
snippet:
Don’t stay here unless you like hotels where literally no one cares about anything. It is chaotic. Check in was after 4 as room wasn’t ready which is just way too late. Coffees ordered at the bar while we were waiting were forgotten about. Filthy tables. They moved us to a new room as ours wasn’t going to be ready until 5pm but cot not set up in room and no bath in family room which seems like an odd decision. Wine ordered ahead of time no sign of. Room cold and noisy. No mention of pool or any other services. They just don’t care in this massive hotel, which fair enough but I would discourage anyone from staying here.
Update: There is an obnoxious party in hotel so it’s even noisier sounds like we’re above a nightclub and had to get a portable heater as heating in room is broken   . If we had known the hotel was going to have a party until 2am we obviously would not have booked this ‘family friendly’ hotel.

name: Rosana Martin Iglesias
snippet: I would definitely come back. The spa was lovely, specially the bath tub facing Galway Bay. The gym is a bit small though, but has all the amenities needed. I would highlight the breakfast buffet, food was lovely and the staff was so pleasant and helpful, specially Juan who looked after us during our whole stay and helped my elderly mom with the plates. Would definitely come back here!

name: James L
snippet:
Writing this from the room we are in.
My sister booked this as a wedding present to my wife and I, plus our 10 month old baby and 3 yr old as we are back from Canada for Christmas and to see the Xmas market.
First off, we had food in the restaurant, which was pretty good, but the service was bad. The server never came back to see if we needed anything once we got served, and we did need some extra service.
The room looks nice and clean apart from when you flush the toilet it is like a generator buzzing to fill again.
The heat couldn't be adjusted in our room also, it was way too hot, and if we opened the window, it was even louder again from the noise outside.
The big kicker was, they knew we had a baby and a young toddler and they put us in a room above the front entrance on the 3rd floor, is it so loud we can't sleep, the music is vibrating through the room and the sound of people outside shouting and whatnot. I'm not sure if it's a wedding, but it's near 12 am right now as i write this, and it is still going.
We are very, very disappointed with the trip as we do not get to do it often with kids. Sad to say, we certainly won't be back again.
Let's just hope i don't have to add to this again when we have breakfast in the morning. Music and party went on til 2am, people shouting and roaring til 3am. I will be looking for a complete refund from this joke of a so called 4-star hotel.

Nearby activities: Christmas market. Shopping center

name: Tomas Sullivan
snippet:
Nice cot for the baby, good temperature in rooms and nice selection of tea and coffee. Really central location in Galway city.

The breakfast buffet was absolutely amazing for someone who hasn't had a fry up in years.

name: Chris Rankin
snippet:
We Stayed here two nights, great hotel, great location!  The rooms were well appointed, clean and spacious.  Everything worked as it should.  We had breakfast both days.  It was buffet style.  There were plenty of both hot and cold selections.  They had the typical hot items like scrambled eggs, ham / bacon, poached sunny side up eggs, haggis & black pudding, and such
The staff were helpful, courteous and attentive to our needs.

name: Cory H
snippet: Really enjoyed our stay at the Galmont. The location is great, a bit quieter than some of the hotels on Eyre square or the Latin Quarter. My only issues were the window didn't shut tight, so there was a bit of traffic noise and the shower didn't drain great. I mentioned the shower to the front desk but it was not addressed unfortunately.

name: John Paul
snippet: Rooms were fine, good facilities. Did see a hair in one of the glasses in our room after I had poured a drink, but no issues beyond that. The beds are comfortable, decent bathroom. Great location, quiet despite being right beside the bus station, and right beside Eyre Square so Shop Street is very close by also.

name: Gill Doyle
snippet:
Well not sure where to begin.
Perfect location. Service was a complete letdown. So much so we complained about the meal in the restaurant.  Breakfast was not great. And the bar staff and receptionists were not so friendly. In one situation after the disaster of a meal waiting for about 2.5 hours on a dinner with a toddler had to hand back and was spoken to so rude I just had to walk away. I feel for a four-star there definitely needs to be more staff or a little refresh on customer service

name: Eoin McCormack
snippet: We had some issues with room 192 on Friday 10 November. It was disappointing because it was our first night away from our kids in 2 years. The hotel itself, the foray is stunningly decorated for Christmas with a good breakfast and staff do seem very nice and friendly

name: Claire A. Poynton-Smith
snippet: We had a wonderful little stay here, taking advantage of one of the deals advertised on their website. We couldn't have wished for better service and the staff were fab (special shout out to Carl in the bar, Jennifer in the spa, and Clodagh on reception)! A small heads up that when you go for a spa treatment use of the thermal suite is an additional 10 euros (this is where the steam room, sauna, heated lounges are) but this is well worth it. My massage was fantastic and our dinner was unbelievably good - they have merged the bar food menu and Marinas menu for the time being while the restaurant is closed in the evenings.

name: Adrian Sta Ana
snippet:
Great hotel. Stumble upon this lovely hotel on a short a night stay in Galway! Our room is overlooking water just amazing! The rooms are great. Wish we could stay longer but even for 1 night its fab

Rooms: Great hotel in Galway

name: Camila F
snippet:
Lovely staff, location is perfect as you are in the heart of Galway, deluxe suite was 9/10.
What could be better:
- Could consider changing the sad breakfast potatoes for actual hasbrowns
- Have someone enforcing kids to stay out of hot tub, sauna and steam facilities. Primary reason for booking the hotel, was to enjoy the leisure space but, parents can't be trusted to read and follow rules that apply to their kids. We were disturbed several times by children in and out of steam room, sauna and occupying the hot tub when there are signs everywhere that you are not allowed to. Not to mention the teenagers lying to staff saying they were 16 and being believed when they are clearly not.

Rooms: Deluxe suite was big and had an amazing view to the sea

Nearby activities: Christmas market,
Museum, dough bros (best pizza in ireland)

Walkability: Heart of Galway

Noteworthy details: If you are looking to enjoy the pool facilities, try to go during school times, as it's open to the public, once the school is over, it's just a playground

name: MrDavid Kelleher
snippet:
Bed itself was very comfortable, bathroom is dated. Hotel is very clean and staff are excellent.
Hotel is minutes walk from the town Center which is ideal.
Parking is €10 a night.
Pay for breakfast when you arrive it’s €13 as apposed to €20 the next morning.
The fitness Center attached is adequate.

Rooms: Bed is huge and extremely comfortable

name: Fiona Heslin
snippet:
My husband and myself decided to take a much deserved short break and on a recommendation booked your hotel. We had dinner in the room just off the bar
We had starters which were okay, my dinner was cold, no one came to check on us and we the waiter gave us essert menus and after 20 minutes waiting for him to take our order, had to up and ask someone to come down yo us    There were 5 people including ourself for dinner and there were more staff than customers   When we  finished our meal, we asked the waiter thst had served us our food if we could sort out the bill for the meal. His response to my husband was " What meal" .....
To add insult to injury, my husband signed for the bill to have it added to the room as we have always do and settle up when we check out..By the time we got back up to our room, approx 5 mins,  , the phone was ringing and the person on the other end was talking to my husband saying they were coming up to our bedroom with a credit card machine for payment of the dinner.....In all my years visiting hotels I have never heard the likes 9f it. It was as if they were closing the hotel overnight and needed all bills paid.
I cannot express what a huge disappointment is was to stay in your hotel and I certainly won't be staying again and will insure the girl that recommended it doesn't do so to anyone else
I suggest you pass this on to the management as they need to be aware of the issues within the hotel
I own 2 restaurants and I am fully aware of what good customer service is and it was not evident tonight

name: SHAUNNA MCKENNA
snippet: Lovely hotel, reception staff were great. However they must’ve been short staffed over the new year period. The man down by the pool area wasn’t particularly helpful, spa staff were all fantastic.

name: Arno de Wet
snippet:
Overall hotel is well appointed and in a good location. Rooms are modern and fairly comfortable (note that AC turns off after being on too long through the evening).

Most disappointing feature I'd like to share for people's reference is the "realistic" view from rooms (refer to picture). Loch facing rooms are charged extra, yet in actual fact you're on top of a car park and extremely busy road. Traffic noise is highly disruptive and consistent throughout the entire day and night.

name: Donal Byrne
snippet: Bar couldn't make cocktails cos that area was closed!!!!. This happened on both nights. It's the first time I had to pay for a hotel car park. Drink Price is ridiculous. Won't be staying there again. Good location tho.

name: Omar Kadir
snippet:
we stayed in Galmont hotel.myself and my wife and 12 years old son .. we arrived early aone of the supervisour her name is Simona  .she did a great job she helped us to check in and show us our room and had make suer the room are in good condition .the hotel location are central ,close to everythings in galway city ,very clean and good selection of buffet breakfast .

Rooms: Big size room .very clean comfy bed

name: Graham Hyland
snippet:
Disappointed with the hotel and service, the price paid was substantial, but the hotel has deteriorated since i was there a few yrs ago under raddison.
Too many little things weren't right. Doors wouldn't close properly , where I had to pull it closed hard,.many neighbouring occupants slept the night and had their doors open without realising. Sink wouldn't empty, breakfast not great, service at the bar was terrible.
For the price paid I would expect everything to close to perfect but unfortunately too many little things let the experience down.
Sorry, I won't recommend it to others.

name: Avril Green
snippet: Gorgeous hotel, lovely friendly professional staff. Doesn't have an extensive menu but food was fabulous and there was plenty of it. Has its own carpark and guests get a reduced rate.

name: Carol Higgins
snippet: My daughter and I stayed here for a night and had an absolutely wonderful time.  The hotel is beautiful,  the staff are very professional.  The food was excellent and the Xmas decorations were gorgeous.  Thank you we'll be back

name: Daniel O'Mahony
snippet: It's nice but for the price you pay you'd like to get more included. Parking was extra, breakfast was very basic, charged for bathrobes to go to the leisure centre, lockers and swim caps all extra. Vending machines on our floor didn't work and the diet coke from the bar was quite expensive compared to the ones in the vending machine we couldn't buy.

name: Denise Breen
snippet:
We stayed here for a couple of nights for my wife's 50th birthday celebration with our wider family.
The hotel itself has a great location, near Eyre Square, train station and easy access to Shop Street. It's modern, spacious and easy to get around.
Our room was lovely, on 5th floor overlooking Lough Atalia. Bed was very comfy. Bathroom huge with separate bath and shower.
Restaurant was wonderful and food amazing.
But what really made our stay was the team, the staff. Everyone of them were helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. I have to single out Michael in the Marinas restaurant. He is a superstar.
Thank you for an amazing visit. Highly recommended.

name: Mji - Maureen Fallis
snippet: Although we had a room with a view & the location was great  .. we had a “just ok” stay at the Galmont. The hotel was a busy hub and we prefer something quieter & more quaint. Hot tub in the spa was relaxing but steam room not hot enough. My husband loved the Buffett breakfast. So many choices!!! I prefer the intimacy of a family run B&B and in Ireland you can get that!! Had a good brisk walk around the lake & that suited me!!

name: Sophie Negus
snippet: Really nice hotel, staff were friendly and helpful. The spa is beautiful, definitely recommend. The food in the restaurant was very nice. All around a nice experience

name: Deirdre O'Hanlon
snippet: Fabulous place.. we didn't eat here but breakfast was one of the best I have had. Only fault was there was no sound on tvs so we couldn't watch the rugby..

name: Kevin Connaughton
snippet:
Great hotel and location but atrocious service.
Have failed now to respond to 2 emails regarding problems encountered. Terrible service in restaurant including being given the wrong starters and then having to wait 90 minutes for a main meal. As stated, Nicole as yet to reply to our latest emails. Very Very poor service.

Rooms: Clean and Tidy

name: keith Whitaker
snippet: It’s a good place. Similar to a Courtyard. Breakfast not great. Service good. Location really good. Bathroom ok. Good value.

name: Ssantos SSantos
snippet:
Updating : The Manager make an effort to revert the situation and did what he could to help. He was caring and professional... its a pitty a manager alone cannot hold a 4 star rating by himself. He will
Probably be hired by another hotel soon as he seem to be exceeding everybody else
That I interacted with.
I would only go back here or recommend If I knew the entire staff was trained to the same level and the hotel upgraded to actually reach 4 stars standard

name: Alison Donnellan
snippet: Spa has really great facilities and staff. Very clean treatment rooms. Had an incredible massage and facial from Hannah! Would highly recommend.

name: Amy Smith
snippet: I don’t recommend this hotel. Plenty of nicer nearby with far nicer gym facilities. Staff in the gym in particular are rude and unhelpful. They make you feel like a complete burden to ask a query of them. Made for a horrible stay

name: Philomena Kilbane
snippet:
Stayed here last night location was perfect and hotel itself is lovely and clean,service in bar was very good,however our room was freezing,heating wasn't working so we had to get 2 heaters up to room.

Nearby activities: Very close to all attractions in galway city

name: Luiza Abend Moreira
snippet:
Location is great, conveniently close to the train station and city centre. Our room was spacious, our bed was super comfortable and we had a nice view of the sea. Breakfast was delicious with many different options. The only thing that was missing were power sockets near the bed, also it would be nice to have USB sockets as well.

Safety: Not too many people on the streets but we didn't run into any issues. Ireland is overall very safe, at least comparing to other places I've visited in Europe

Walkability: Very close to the train station and city centre

Food & drinks: They have a bar and a restaurant, but I only had breakfast there (which was great)

name: Fiona Murphy
snippet: Had an overnight stay ,good location. But that and friendly staff did not make up for the fact that the view from the room was the local revenue office. The pillows were flat, and the breakfast was cold. No spare toiletries. Very basic for 208e.

name: Greg
snippet: The Galmont was such a great place to stay in Galway. It is a 5 minute walk or less to the train station, which was so nice considering we saved a lot of money not taking a cab or bus from the train to the hotel! It is close the to the town square where there are some pubs and shopping, and just beyond the square is the Latin Quarter which was the highlight of our time in Galway. I don't think we walked more than 15 minutes to get anywhere from the Galmont Hotel and Spa. Staff was very friendly, the add-on breakfast was delicious (it does get very busy at times), and the bar had great drinks and awesome food. The main restaurant had delicious food for a nice evening staying in. We did not try the pool or spa, but by the looks of many people carrying towels or in robes, it seems to be used regularly. The room was nice, bed was comfortable, and the room had climate control. Depending on which side you are facing, there are some great views of the town or the water. We would totally stay here again due to its proximity to the train station and the nightlife!

name: ROY GOLDING
snippet: Stayed there 15/16 sept .cost 690 for bb+ one evening meal .requested a room at a lower level in the hotel we were given the 4th floor.asked for twin beds got a king size bed the restaurant looked nice on the surface but the carpets and the decor shabby.the carpets at the lifts exit  are threadbare .went to watch the    in the bar.there were 2 lights in front of the TV flickering.asked a manager to turn them off said he would but nothing happened,then asked a barman to turn them off still nothing.the lights were still flickering the next morning. The bathroom was tired and small and needs to be changed to walk-in showerthe breakfast had a great selection.the hotel is not a 4star standard

name: Louise McGann
snippet: Beautiful hotel, 10/10. Staff are handpicked,  so helpful and professional and really dedicated to providing a high level of service at all time. Only issue, not enough staff at times. Long waits for food, drinks ect . Breakfast is very good probably the best hotel breakfast I ever had. Typical buffet style,  help yourself.  But, they also have a menu,  with lots to choose from. All in all, a lovely hotel .

name: Katey Ferenzi
snippet:
It's pretty rare I'm bummed out about a hotel, but this was darn pretty expensive. Any one of these things is no big deal, but all together for the final price of almost 1,000k = not for us.

Things happen, cultural differences, etc. - no biggie. I totes respect that. However, we had some obnoxious banging through the entire night that there was really no apology or even offer of compensate despite multiple reports from guests (see video). The next morning as we checked out the front desk said "we've had multiple people have issues" The staff member scribbled down our room number (along with many others) on the footer of a printout for something entirely different (hotel info sheet or something of the like). For the cost compared to other options, well just never stay here again is all. It was our splurge hotel during our trip to Ireland...

Th HVAC/fan issues were after we encountered the following...

We got stuck on an elevator for a while + elevators would beep incessantly as they got stuck open on our floor multiple times a day.

To get out of the hotel there are several doors/options (automated) and every day one or the other was broken or hanging wide open letting cold air flow into the lobby/bar.

The elevator doors to the hotel spa were dented and dirty. Although the staff in the spa busted their butts for everyone!

The food at the at the hotel was bland compared to everything else in Galway. Plus, very expensive for way smaller portions or similar things offered elsewhere. I'd recommend many options (similar) plates in Galway for the cost that'll blow your mind.

Our shower, despite our efforts, would leak/pool on the floor. The rubber under the door was molded and worn out.

The toilet needed one pump and then lifted up then down and held to flush each time.

The HVAC fan noises all night were the straw that broke the camel's back for us though + how little they cared that it was a pervasive issue (again, many room numbers written in the footer as they asked for payment)

Again, all little things and no big deal. However all together + how little they seemed to care about any of it + total cost of a room = not for us. We'll give another place a go when we visit Ireland next year (we do yearly trips as we love Ireland).

name: Kristin Osborne
snippet:
Location is excellent but the rooms were a little dirty. Rooms facing the lough can be loud because of the traffic.
Breakfast was excellent.

name: Basak Onur
snippet:
As someone who has worked in the travel industry for more than 10 years and traveled a lot and stayed in hotels very often, I must state that the location of the hotel is very good, the rooms are spacious and the leisure center is above the Irish 4 star hotel average.  I would like to share my negative experiences as well, First of all, it is unbelievable that such a hotel charges 10 Euros per night to its guests in its own parking lot.  Not a huge amount, but do they need it? I think they should reevaluate this.
Anyway, the most negative experience we had at the hotel was about room cleaning. The toilet of the room we stayed in was not cleaned, the toilet lid was covered with dirt and the waste bin of the toilet was not taken. At the same time, we had to order the bathrobes and slippers because they were not available in the room. Actually, I wasn't going to write this review and I wasn't going to add the photos, but when I explained the situation after I checked out from the hotel at the reception, they said that they followed up with the housekeeper after my initial contact and the housekeeper said that the room was completely cleaned. So what I said was denied. I hope they were convinced when I showed them the photos. I think this is an individual experience, it can happen in all hotels, there is only a bad process management. To be fair the hotel overall is nice, location is great, but they need to be more sensitive about cleanliness and more responsive and proactive about process management.

name: gary tuohy
snippet:
Arrived at 3pm . Room was supposed to be ready at 4pm. Waited until 4:45.

Room was very standard and grubby, chips out of all furniture , electrical cables sticking up from headboard . Carpet at the window soaking wet and extremely mouldy all around the window as was leaking in through the wall.

Room service took 30 mins for just 2 beers .

I’d rate it a 1/2 star . Wouldn’t go bank again

name: micheal brennan
snippet:
Hotel was very nicely presented and staff where very helpful but ventilation system was incredibly loud and woke us up at 6am

Rooms: Noisy ventilation

Nearby activities: Na

name: Shari Carrusca
snippet:
My Mum and I had a great stay at the Galmont. We were visiting from Australia.
The staff were so friendly and helpful. The food was great,
and our room was clean and had a fridge which was fantastic.
The day spa at The Galmont is beautiful I highly recommend spoiling yourself and having a treatment there it's Amazing.

name: Joddie Ames
snippet: We started out with a wonderful waiting staff. We ended up with someone else. He was rude and ignored us until I flagged down  another staff member and asked for our bill. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful.

name: Jaylon Milosh
snippet: The massages are amazing however the hot rooms are not great alot of them didn't work but overall was okay

name: Flo Horsman Hogan
snippet: Attended a conference here in July. Wasn't impressed by the service. Ran out of tea / coffee with no refills. Colleagues who stayed  said the rooms were lovely but service wasn't great. Good location though...5 min from bus /train station. Right beside Eyre Square

name: Eymard Brennan
snippet: Hotel has good location for the city centre 5 min walk,Galway can be a nightmare to get through with traffic so leave yourself plenty of time,the hotel car park is ideal for small cars, big Jeep,car drivers be careful.Staff are brilliant food is great.

name: Shari Papczun
snippet:
Updated 7/28/23: I connected with the manager who was empathetic to our experience and worked with us to resolve our issues.

Original post:
Was excited for first Ireland stop in Galway. Debated on hotel and decided on Galmont (mostly due to high reviews).

Checked in yesterday. Location is good, staff is ok. Room is dated and tired looking/feeling. Towels are threadbare and were dirty before we even used them. Hair was left in the shower from previous guest(s). We forgot our international adapters and were told by front desk they had none to loan. Seems strange for a 4-star hotel catering to foreign travelers. Also asked for new towels and was handed very worn, rough and threadbare towels by the night manager. Would have expected higher level of quality control when being handed them directly by staff. Wish I would have gone with the other hotel I was considering.

Galway seems like a great city, I would suggest a different hotel based on quality, service and prices are high for what you get at Galmont.

name: Rachie Doo
snippet: Location is great but i feel this was once a great hotel but has gone downhill. Its in need of a lick of paint, the corridor carpets look dirty they are so faded and old. The bathrooms are dated and need upgrading, the silicone seals are turning black. I didnt sleep till after 4am beacuse of the heat in the hotel- and i had no radiator on in the room. You have to walk miles and get 2 elevators to even find your room. Location is the only thing that makes this hotel worth the price as it's on the expensive side compared to others.

name: Paul Church
snippet:
Lovely hotel in a great city location overlooking the shallow tidal Lough Atalia.
Reception/function rooms/ Bar areas are totally class!

Nearby activities: Right by the city centre, really easy to nip into town.
And by railway/ buscstation/ multistorey carpark.

name: M OC
snippet: Fantastic food, service, and attention to detail for a special occasion. We had our sons' communion recently and would highly recommend for any occasion. We were delighted with the service from initially planning the event with the hotel to the day itself. Thank you and well done to everyone concerned.

name: Nicholas Foad
snippet:
Comfortable and reasonably sized rooms. Great service at the front desk, they were able to accommodate a late change in my planned stay. Food in restaurants surprisingly good. Only downside is ac in room cuts out overnight leaving you too hot.  Great location close to old town Galway. Id come back...

Nearby activities: Old town only 5 minutes walk for restaurants shopping and great pubs

name: jackie doherty
snippet: Lovely hotel,nice area very helpful staff, lots of lovely walks around Galway city picture is from railway bridge access from train station area

name: Marie O Laoi
snippet: Spent 2 nights B&B and evening meal package. Very nice hotel, friendly and helpful  staff. Air conditioning in the bedroom didn't work, and there was no free room available to move to. However, we were given an upgrade the second night to a beautiful room with a balcony and air conditioning.

name: joan Clarke
snippet: Beautiful hotel...staff nice... need Deaf Awareness and sign language, please

name: Derek Kelly
snippet: Lovely hotel we enjoyed our two night stay at The Galmont. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice rooms we had a view of the sea. Walking distance to everything in the city. We didn't have dinner but the breakfast was very good plenty of choice couldn't fault it. We used the Leisure Centre once it was fairly limited. Jacuzzi wasn't working nor was the steam room. Outside hot tub was nice but again not working properly which was disappointing. Overall a good experience if a little overpriced. Would consider staying again on next visit to Galway.

name: Nick Titcombe
snippet: We were very happy with this hotel. Great location, easy to walk to from the bus or train. Excellent choice of restaurants, friendly staff, well equipped gym and spa. Rooms are well equipped and have everything you need. The sea view is worth it. Lovely sunrise every morning.

name: Richard
snippet:
Service excellent as always, decent gym with free weights section, kettlebells, ski erg, assault fitness equipment.

Rooms: Decent sized clean, quiet room; good to work from or chill out in.

name: Kerry Brock
snippet: Great hotel stay.  Excellent location within your kind of distance of the city center.

name: Tom Morrissey
snippet: My wife and I spent 3 night winter stay here and we were so glad we picked this hotel. The parking is very convenient and with all the action and shopping you want just around the corner it was perfect. Breakfast had something for everyone with a great selection. I used the gym which is well equipped and my wife used the spa and pool and was more than pleased with both. We will definitely stay there again and maybe enjoy a drink outside on the patio in better weather next time.

name: Buck Foster
snippet:
This was one of our favorite places to stay on our entire weeklong Ireland trip from the United States. We ask for a three person room and got a king size bed and a full size bed. The rooms were incredibly big. The staff was super nice. The hotel and the rooms and the grounds were extremely clean. The location is not that far from all of the shopping and dining that you could ever imagine. We walked down to the area for food and shopping. It is in Easy walking distance of the king's head Pub, which is all you need to know.

Rooms: Rooms were large and clean an incredibly comfortable.

name: Lisa Sayers
snippet:
I've absolutely nothing negative to say about the place. We've been here a couple of times now and it's been lovely each time. The staff have been friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and modern and the food was tasty. We'll stay again!

Walkability: Located a 2 minute walk off of Eyre Square, but without feeling like it's in the centre of the busyness once you're inside. It's an ideal location to wander in and around the city.

name: Aine Murphy
snippet: Breakfast was fantastic. So many options - one of the best buffet breakfast I've seen. Good gym set up and outdoor hot tub    great location - really near bus/train station and short walk to Eyre Square. Paying for parking is only drawback - €10 per night

name: liam lally
snippet:
This ultra modern hotel was wonderful for a two nights  break. The service was friendly and efficient apart from breakfast.
The restaurant for the self-service breakfast   was busy .Tea and toast should be served to the guests' table . The breakfast staff need basic training. Use a tea pot for tea and a coffee pot for coffee.
Food.
Stalks should be removed from mushrooms before they are cooked  . Sausages need to be cooked thoroughly. Fried eggs should not be overcooked. The breakfast food and  operation was not  managed .   

Walkability: It's only a short walk to the City Centre( 5 minuits).

name: Maureen Roche
snippet: Just back from our stay at the galmont. We had the most relaxing 3 day's,did not want to leave the hotel. Donald in the restaurant went over and above to make our stay more relaxing. Had a beautiful massage,and think I may have slept through it all!!. Overall found the terminal suite amazing, only down side was , found the lights in the beach very bright. Will definitely be back

name: Tara Spalding
snippet: We stayed here a few nights and it was a very pleasant stay. Room was nice, bed was comfy and the bath was spacious. Everything is within walking distance as well. The restaurant was very good and the breakfast had nice gluten free options too. Would def stay here again.

name: PRCD Ex
snippet: I just came here with my family for dinner. Food is excellent and reasonable value for money. The surroundings are very pleasant and relaxing and service was also excellent and quick. So, for a pleasant evening out with friends or significant other this is a fine place to go ☺️

name: Cindy
snippet: Great Hotel with spa and gym, superior breakfast options. We would definitely come again.

name: Joe Mangieri
snippet: My wife and I checked in with me being COVID positive and her negative until a couple of days later. The staff were very understanding, booked us separate rooms at first, took proper precautions, and were extremely forthcoming with assistance and accommodating special requests. It was also obvious that the staff communicates well with each other. We were lucky that this was the hotel we had to isolate in for the above reasons, plus the food was great, wifi was reliable, and we had windows that opened and climate control that kept the room comfortable with plenty of air movement. We can't give enough praise for all of the staff - reception, housekeeping, bar and restaurant. Everyone was engaged, pleasant and helpful.

name: Walid Hamdy
snippet: Good business like hotel, clean and new with nice rooms and views. But a bit out of the way from the main square so area around the hotel itself is very quiet. Only a few minutes walk though so not too bad.

name: Wieland Schreiner
snippet:
Hi,
I was here out of business reason.
As a normal business person I start my work at 8:00am in the morning unfortunately sitting as so many colleagues much to much the whole day.
The only time to exercise, have a healthy breakfast, check out and travel to the office is in the morning before 8:00am.
In Galmont Hotel they unfortunately sleep too long - the Fitness room and the restaurant open at 7:00am earliest consequently with long waiting queues in front of both       
My ask to open earlier was refused!

I will not come again as my 20 colleagues!
If you don‘t get it - this is a wake up call!

Btw nuts and almonds are missing at the breakfast - easy to fix

name: Ian Mason
snippet: Appalling; The staff on reception and in the bar did not know what they were doing. Everything from the simplest drinks request to maintenance of the air conditioning was beyond their comprehension. Very slow to respond to any request. In fact our room air-conditioning did not work upon arrival, I called 3 times for someone to fix it but NO!. Ended up in changing our room at 11.30pm. Will not return!

name: Shuttermaniac ProductionsTM
snippet:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Galmont Hotel in Galway and was impressed by the professionalism and hospitality of two staff members in particular: receptionist Shane and bartender Ignacio.

Shane, who greeted me upon my arrival, was welcoming and efficient. He quickly checked me into my room, provided me with a map of the city, and gave me some helpful tips on places to visit during my stay. Throughout my stay, he was always available to answer my questions and went out of his way to make sure my experience was a positive one. His warm and friendly demeanor made me feel at home in the hotel, and I would highly recommend him to anyone visiting the Galmont.

During my stay, I also had the pleasure of visiting the hotel bar, where I met Ignacio. He was an outstanding bartender who took the time to make sure that every drink he prepared was perfectly crafted. His knowledge of the different types of alcohol and mixers was impressive, and he was always willing to make recommendations based on my preferences. His passion for his craft was evident in the quality of the drinks he made, and his friendly and engaging personality made the experience even more enjoyable.

Overall, I would highly recommend the Galmont Hotel to anyone visiting Galway, and specifically, I would like to commend Shane and Ignacio for their exceptional service. Their professionalism, warmth, and attention to detail made my stay at the Galmont a memorable one, and I look forward to returning in the future.

name: Leila -
snippet:
We didn't stay at the hotel.
Just spent time at their restaurant.
Excellent service!
Keep it up guys!!

name: Jill J
snippet: Great location with ability to walk to The Docks or Eyre Square. Delicious breakfast with so many options included. Comfy room and we had a view of Lough Atalia.

name: Ber Mcelligott
snippet:
I attended a conference here over 4 days but didn't stay here.  I had lunch 2 of those days and the food was great.

Walkability: So close to the town centre  but not so close that its noisy.

Food & drinks: I could not fault the food. Had lunch and dinner there and it was so good!

name: Barry Whelan
snippet:
Spent two nights here and had a brilliant time. Upon arrival we got a very unexpected upgrade to the top floor executive room. The room was massive and also had a full length balcony with a beautiful view of Lough Atalia and out to the bay.

Breakfast was really good, plenty of choice and a help yourself buffet.

We also had dinner as part of the package. We couldn't eat the desert as we were totally stuffed after the starter and main course.

Staff were very helpful. Really enjoyed our stay here and it's a great location as it's only a few minutes walk into town.

name: Mary Reilly
snippet:
Could do with attention..very shabby . ...
Rooms ok
,Definitely,  not worth  the price paid for 2 night stay ov er graduation !

name: Patrica Quigley
snippet: This was fab hotel beautifull place for the graduation college grad, everything was spot on service food  warm cosey  yes really fab spot

name: Olivia Sheahan
snippet: Hotel is lovely issue with my window that night. Not fully sealed so heard the wind all night.

name: lainey Egan
snippet: I had a group spa day here and it hard to organise all the different treatments and times for everyone but the staff was brilliant the day went so well, everyone really enjoyed the experience. The place was a proper Spa with relaxation rooms, therapy rooms and thermal suite. You were never rushed and the staff was fabulous. I'd rate as best Spa in West of Ireland by far.

name: Hazel Buchanan
snippet:
I’ve stayed here a few times now and I’ve never been disappointed.
The hotel is easy to get to, has car parking & a short stroll has you in the hustle & bustle.
Our bedroom was a huge corner room with views of Lough Atalia. The bed was massive with pillows that you sunk into & a fabulous duvet that hugged you - bliss!
The Thermal Suite in the Spa was so relaxing, the heated beds sent me to sleep after my massage. I has asked for a deep massage from Jennifer & that’s what I got.
Throughout the hotel the staff are very friendly & knowledgeable. I’ll definitely be back again.

name: Troy McAlister
snippet: Nice hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. Your walk to your room could be 10 minutes and involve two lifts. The beds were a bit cheap, but the room was fairly clean and the hotel had nice amenities and a great location.

name: Gianluca Cani
snippet: The Hotel has a good position since it is near the centre of Galway which can be reached on foot. I had a standard suite on the 2nd floor watching the entrance of the hotel. The breakfast is abundant although I didn't find it particularly tasty. The housekeeping was decent but the night tables and desk were left dusty for three days, although left empty, and the toilet flush was not working on day one; this was fixed when I reported it at the front desk. The bathroom has a decent size but, besides a rack on top of the toilet there was not a second hook to hang a towel, close to the shower or the sink, the water pressure was feeble. There was a usb charging port in the wall socket next to the bed but not at the desk, that's a pity. The bed and linens were good. The overall complementary services were decent too. I found it weird that they had food and drinks distributors working exclusively with coins and no coin distributor nor coins available at the front desk.  The moquette and furniture were a little dated and worn off so was the cutlery and dishes, cups,etc. The price of the rooms is slightly high, all considered, but aligned with the hotel category.

name: Claire Thomson
snippet:
Overpriced Holiday Inn. The entrance has been brought up to date, however, the rooms are dated and bland. Not worth the money.

Rooms: Basic

Walkability: Good walking distance to the centre of town, although, clearer directions would have been appreciated

Food & drinks: Good but not noteworthy.

name: Don RS
snippet:
Excellent location, good staff all around. Wonderful front office staff. Very professional and helpful.

Good Breakfast. There are so many varieties. Freshly made. Great staff, willing to help.

The bar food is excellent. Supervisor Raj in the restaurant is a great operator—excellent at dealing with customers.
Room service is top-class. Clean, spacious room. Brand new condition.

Overall, 10 out of 10.  Great hotel.

Rooms: First class.

name: Tea and Cake for the Soul
snippet:
The rooms were fairly small but nice enough with a big comfy bed, free water, tea and coffee, etc. There was an issue with the extractor fan our bathroom, but the staff quickly moved us to a different room, so can't complain about the service at all.

The communal areas of the hotel were fabulous, as was the pool with indoor and outdoor hot tubs (be aware you will need to wear a swim hat to use them - on sale at the pool desk for 3E)

The breakfast area was huge and well equipped with hot and cold buffet items, and table service for freshly cooked meals and drinks. Even though it was busy, service was quick and there was plenty of room.

We stayed during the Christmas festivities, and it was an extremely busy hotel with lots of functions being held and as a result drink and food service was slow in the bar during the evening.

The hotel is in an ideal location for a short stay in the city centre and a short drive from the beach areas. There is a safe underground car park for guests for a reasonable fee.

name: Spike
snippet:
This hotel and all of its connected restaurants have demonstrated an exceptional level of poor service and bad quality that in the end I can't give it more than one star. This hotel seems like it wants to be a luxury hotel that is worthy of its purported 4 stars, but falls short of that in so many ways it should have it's stars revoked. Avoid staying here, find somewhere else.

Our room was not overly clean and had fallen behind on its maintenance. There were clear signs of damage that had been haphazardly covered up, in one case with duct tape rather than any proper fix. There were scuff marks everywhere, and paint drips where they had quickly applied a sloppy coverup. The bathroom was riddled with mold, much of which would have been very easy to clean up had someone tried. Several of the fixtures were rusting, which was a common sight throughout the hotel. The elevators made scary screeching noises, another sign of poor maintenance practices.

We ended up getting room service because we walked out of the restaurant after being abandoned by the service down there. The room service took nearly an hour to bring up our simple order and the food was not good. It was edible, but continues the trend of the food at this hotel being the worst dining we have experienced in ireland, which so far had been great. They also brought our food up on dirty plates that clearly had not been cleaned properly. There was only a single napkin for 2 people, and they did not bring a knife for the steak. Our ice cream was melted and more of a soup. Additionally the individual serving container of ketchup that they provided had clearly been used previously as evidenced by it's broken seal and dried ketchup under the cap along with food stains on the bottle. A completely unacceptable level of bad service.

Avoid this hotel, there has to be better places to stay in Galway that won't do a disservice to the wonderfulness that we have otherwise experienced in Ireland.

name: марина ткачева
snippet: Huge disappointment. In the hotel right now. For 315 euro got a small old room with tiny bathroom. No breakfast included.Service is awful-requested a dining in the room 40 minutes ago, still have not received it. Called to the reception-was out on hold for 10 minutes 3 times.

name: Karen Biggins
snippet: We booked a Level 5 suite and it was fab. We were given a complimentary drinks voucher as it was my friend's birthday by Iman who checked us in. The room was fab, very spacious with a balcony and lovely Elemis toiletries. We didn't eat there but we did really enjoy a lovely glass of bubbles out on the verandah before heading out for dinner.

name: Sarah O'Reilly
snippet:
We were booked in a Classic Room, and it was made clear at booking that this would require taking a second elevator to get to the room. This was fine. However, it was NOT made clear that these rooms do not have true windows, as an opaque window that you cannot see through is not a window. This should be clearly stated. The photos of the room online show a view, so this is a bait and switch.

The overall experience was simply not what was advertised. The lobby area is modern, upscale, and airy. However, once you turn the corner toward the bedrooms, it is dark, dingy, faded, and old. The hallways smelled of cigarette smoke and marijuana, and the long walk to our room felt like we were being punished for booking the classic room.

The breakfast experience was poor. We arrived at 7:30am, only 30min after opening, and all the "hot" food was cold. We were brought cups, but not offered coffee, and servers seemed to be actively ignoring us. We had to shout at someone running by to get coffee. Other guests seated after us at nearby tables were immediately brought coffee as they were seated, but they were not given cups to drink the coffee. We stayed two nights, and went elsewhere for breakfast the second morning, even though we had paid extra to book the breakfast rate.

Having to go to the front desk to validate the parking ticket every single time you enter/exit the garage (that is explicitly for the hotel!) is ridiculous for a hotel of this size. It should be accessible with your room key, or with a code specific to the hotel.

name: Lindsay M
snippet:
Rooms were clean and comfortable, friendly staff and a great location for a visit to Galway.
I had room service a few nights, it was quick and very delicious (though expensive). Also attended an event and found the events team to be excellent.
Lovely little spa was a real bonus, I enjoyed the visit and would stay again.
My only complaint is that the hotel hosts a lot of tour groups which often meant queues at the reception and noisy crowds in the hallways early in the morning.

name: Rónán D
snippet:
I have visited Galway many times but my recent stay in the Galmont was my first. Overall our stay was ok, service at the front desk is good and the location is ideal for walking to the centre of the city.

However we were quite disappointed by the standard of the room. At approx €330 per night the room we got was quite basic. It was clean but dated with a tight, basic bathroom space. We needed to take 2 separate lifts to get to the room from reception.  The shape of the hotel means that many of the rooms face onto the U-Shaped hotel entrance way. This means that if staying in these rooms you will clearly hear nosier guests returning to the hotel at night. There also seems to be a smoking area for the main function room near the reception entrance which also created at lot of noise for us ater 1am.

We did not eat in the restaurant in the evening but did get the breakast on the first morning. The buffet breakfast itself was very average with your standard fry up. Communication from the staff about what the breakfast arrangement entails was also very poor.

I appreciate that inflation and other factors have resulted in price rises across the industry. For me this trip was a lesson to shop around and do a bit more research to make sure you get as much bang for buck as possible

name: Eliza Bradley
snippet:
Update. After staying here two nights, I can only downgrade my review. The hotel is too loud. You can hear people walking and talking all through the night around the hotel. Also, their atm machine tried to eat my card. There is housekeeping and reception but no other staff in this four star hotel. No concierge, no luggage porters. You are on your own. It is a short walk to Eyre Square which is a nice area. But the walk is by the bus and train station with lots of vehicular and human traffic. I can't figure out where you park in Galway in order to drive to dinner. I don't see any convenient parking like I have in Killarney or other towns.

Initial post. So far my experience is very mixed here. The people seem friendly but we arrived after 4pm and could not get our room. Nobody helped with our luggage and now I'm waiting for my comped drink. I ordered a Margarita thinking that would be okay, but now I'm not sure.
The location is pretty with a nice view. I'm not sure that it is convenient or close to anything. I'll explore and provide an update later.

name: Jon Dickinson
snippet:
Only there for an overnight but location is good, service couldn't be better, didn't do food so can't comment.
Will be back for longer stay.

name: Daniel Boras
snippet: This is a hotel that looks fabulous from the outside and when you walk in to the lobby, but it doesn’t really justify the price that it charges once you go deeper into the hotel.  First, no one at the hotel offered any assistance whatsoever with our luggage when we were arriving or departing. Secondly,  it can take so long to get to the other end of the hotel, that I think a plane can make it to its gate before you actually get to your rooms.  If they give you the 1280-90 suites, there is really no view to see other than a fence and concrete.  Thirdly, when I needed an emergency toiletry late at night, I called front desk and they never arrived.  Finally, the breakfast was subpar with little to no variety.

name: Conan Croghan
snippet:
Nice room but no air con at back so too hot. Staff gave us a fan which helped a bit. Food was ok but not consistent quality.  Desserts were poor. Starters varied and somemains had to be sent back. Beef was gristly and premade salads brown. Cooked breakfast buffet was very poor. Young staff trying hard and apprreciated their efforts.

Nearby activities: Not far to beach and promenade ckose to town and entertainment.

Walkability: Within walking distanceof all

name: Amanda Forde
snippet: Spa experience very disappointing for three friends galmont has gone done hill young girls doing massage had definitely not much experience place was cold water In pool was cold and dressing rooms dirty very disappointing

name: Jordan T.
snippet:
room was fairly nice but the AC/furnace didn't work at all (even just the fan to move air around) and the window barely opened with no screen, so my room was insanely hot even though it's freezing outside. generally the entire hotel felt very warm. no stand alone fan in the room either. I know this may be a small thing for some people but I sleep very hot so made it very uncomfortable. I contacted maintenance as we were going out to lunch and was assured it would be taken care of, but came back to a sauna. restaurant for breakfast was fantastic but room service was mundane. burger patty, as well as the bacon, were completely burnt and pizza was cold by the time we got it. overall, I'd probably stay here again, but purely for lack of options.

I will say that the staff was very friendly though, something I greatly appreciate!

name: Lisa Reed
snippet: Our friends room was 2 hours late being ready & when they finally got in the room it was not liveable at all so they had to switch rooms which took another hour. The showers have absolutely no shelves for your own toiletry items at all nor a place to hang your towels. The design of the room was not well thought out for user convenience. For a highly rated "spa" hotel this was not what we expected.

name: Elisabeth Thompson
snippet: The Galmont was an extremely clean hotel. The amenities included a full bath, Nespresso, and air conditioning. The rooms were large and comfortable. The staff was welcoming and helpful. There was an extensive breakfast buffet that was replenished half way through breakfast hours.

name: Jairo Muñiz Rodríguez
snippet: I've been in the Galmont for two nights and everything was outstanding. The night manager Khalid went far and beyond to gave to my girlfriend and I the best stay possible. Galmont is really lucky to have staff like him. Overall a great place to stay.

name: Lillian Stone
snippet: We were really disappointed in our accommodations at the Galmont. The only window in our room looked directly into the hotel lobby, which made the room feel very exposed. The window also did not open which is a safety issue. Additionally the hotel electrical breaker and HVAC system access were in our room, which made it apparent that the room had been a supply closet that was recently converted into a hotel room. When booking, make sure they do not give you room 163. The accommodations at this hotel are not as advertised.

name: Suzanne Brady
snippet:
I'll never go back, spent a lot of money and was very disappointed with our stay,

Rooms: Paid just shy of 500euro for a 2 day stay and was more then disappointed

Food & drinks: Food in the restaurant cold and tasteless, staff never came back to us to see if we wanted another drink or anything else

Noteworthy details: Staff very badly trained if trained at all in how to deal with the public , bar man very rude to an old man looking for assistance

name: Gerry
snippet:
Repost since they had it removed for being "misleading". I cannot get any more literal about my experience.

Originally posted on 16/03/23.

I made this account just to post this review. Hopefully it helps somebody.

First and foremost, my experience is solely with being at an event in this establishment.

If you don't have time to read more into why I think this is the case, I will summarise:

- the private security hired for the event (one of whom had no ID band) are told to force guests waiting in the lobby, after leaving the event, out of the door no matter what elements outside present themselves. (It was heavy rain in my case)

- you have no option of re-entry. (They take off wristbands or any other identifying factor upon exiting the function room.)

- service is fine at best, food is average as  expected for large events

- after a few hours the function room gets very stuffy with very little ventilation. The only option for getting fresh air was a tiny, unsheltered, designated "smoking" area.

To continue I can't comment on whether or not the rooms besides the function room were of standard or not, however the location is convenient at most. You are better off considering another hotel to host an evening event at in Galway.

To get into the grits of it all:
The standard that the security and reception treat individuals once they leave the function room (this was no later than 11pm with seemingly no evident possiblity of re-entry [they take wristbands off when leaving]) and head into the lobby can only be described as RUDE and COLD.
My group were in suits and dresses, nevertheless we were ushered out into the lashing rain and told to go into the "shelter" (a high awning no thick as 50cm) that did nothing for the southerly wind that blew the rain onto us.

The security was forcing people out into the wind and heavy rain (regardless of whether waiting for a lift/taxi). After speaking to the security this was no doubt by order of the hotel itself simply to keep people out of the lobby. - *Mind you this was no later than 11pm and at previously ORGANISED event.*
The security in the lobby were very snarky and rude. Making sly comments as people walked by and also making sarcastic comments to people inquiring as to why they were being forced into the rain. The hotel has much to answer for in this case.

I have lost all respect for this hotel.

My advice ultimately is; if you are planning on having an event at this hotel that somewhat leads into the night; consider other options.

-G

name: Stephen Diesen
snippet: Great location for bus, train, and Aran Island Ferry.  Less than ten minute ealk to tourist shops.  Tried to check in early but was unsuccessful. When I booked through the hotel, they didn't get my room selection quite correct, which led to more delay.  Great breakfast and restaurants.  Make reservations for spa regardless if they say it is ealk-in.

name: frankie o toole
snippet: was here for our anniversary had a great time nice food pleasant staff great views.

name: Aisling Stephens
snippet:
I was brought away for my 50th birthday for a night in The Galmont Hotel. So delighted to be treated to a night away by my nieces and sister. The hotel is in a perfect location and staff in hotel were very helpful. My issue was with the spa. I was treated to a therapy along with my stay and the therapist yawned 4 times quite loudly over my head. I asked her was she tired and she laughed. I also had   an head massage along with a back massage but the head massage was the worst I have ever had. They therapist stayed massaging the same spot and did not even touch the back of my head or neck. My niece had a similar experience with her therapist and we mentioned it the person on the spa reception and we were offered our therapies free of charge. I hope my therapist was provided with extra training on how to behave professionally when dealing with clients. I won't be back in a hurry.
Room was excellent and cannot fault it. We had adjoining rooms on the 4th floor.

name: Suzanne Campbell
snippet: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, and I have travelled extensively. Checking in was a nightmare, long lines. The room smells of chemicals and just feels dirty. To find our room we had to take 2 different elevators and walk thru a maze of hallways that are dirty and kids running thru the halls. It’s a scam of a hotel, def not 4 stars not even close. Don’t waste your money.

name: Glenn Goldsmith
snippet:
I am torn between 2 or 4 stars. I engaged with 3 members of staff, room service, bar and reception. All very professional and pleasant. The female receptionist was extremely nice and pleasant, I had to leave early due to a family emergency and that person helped with a rebate on the early booking. I thank that person very much.
Here's the issue, the night before I decided to eat in the bar, I ordered fish and chips, after 30 mins I enquired after my food and the bar staff said he would speak to the kitchen, 45 mins I asked again, after 90 mins I gave up.
It seems to me the hotel is extremely busy but not enough staff, which seems to be the post covid.

name: KIERAN CASSIDY
snippet: Sadly I've no positive reviews for this hotel. We as a couple go for Galway Races and have previously stayed at the Galmont but this time sadly we had a few problems. The bathroom shower was hanging from the wall which the water was directed to the bathroom floor and the the towels were in bad condition stained and tired. Lastly when we arrived back to hotel in the pouring rain we were stopped by security on the road who requested our reservation in hotel which we had to provided but the guy was was still a bit apprehensive....but finally let us in.. A LOT OF WORK TO BE DONE GALMONT......

name: Diana Johnston
snippet:
This place seems to have been nice at some point, but if that's the case, I assure you that it has gone downhill.
Fortunately I only had to stay one night in this place, so I made it work.
We stayed here as part of a group tour, and we were not really given any special treatment(or normal hospitality, even).
I am a travel advisor and have stayed in ALOT of hotels...from 1 star to 5-stars...
This is more like a 2 star pretending to be a 4 star.
The first room we were assigned to, I went through my usual rigamarole to make sure that everything works.
I've been doing this since the pandemic as many rooms had been unused during this time and stuff breaks without anyone know.
It happens.
So we are assigned our room.
I check everything...the toilet doesn't work.
The room also is visibly dirty.
There were crumbs on the desk and a nice shoe print on the comforter.
Okay, no big deal.
I'll just ask for another room and they can fix that on their own time.
I called down to the front desk. I let it ring for about 7 min.
No answer.
I go down to the front desk. Tell them the situation.
They tell me that they cannot give me another room, and they can have someone look at the toilet.
I told them the room was unsatisfactory anyway, it would be easier just to give a different room.
They tell me the same thing, and say they will have someone look at it after they get all the luggage unloaded as a big group just checked in.
I'm like "uhhh yeah I'm with that big group".
I don't see how they have anything to do with fixing a toilet, but what do I know?
Anyways, I go and have myself a drink and have dinner at the hotel (dinner ended up take 3 hours, service was so slow...way understaffed).
My tour group manager started that he talked to the desk and assured me that the problem was fixed.
We get up to the room, close to 1030 pm. Nothing has been fixed.
The toilet hasnt even been flushed.
I go down to the desk again.
They again tell me that someone had fixed it.
I calmly disagree.
They get the manager.
They upgraded us to the "business suite", which looks exactly the same, but with a working toilet.
Also, pretty much the entire floor was empty, so they could have very just done this 3 hours prior.
Whatever.
Ice machine was also on a different floor (no big deal, but good to know).
Breakfast the following morning was the worst in the trip, just because the service was so bad and they were so short staffed.
Staff was apologetic, but we still didn't get coffee until the end of the meal, and people were sitting down at dirty tables because no one was available to clean.
Yuck.
Well, I would stay anywhere but here, at least until they get hair act together.
I understand that they are short staffed, but alot of this could have been resolved by just giving us a different room to begin with.

name: Don Deane
snippet: Went to a Union conference.  The beds were very comfortable and i got a couple of great sleeps. The hotel staff were friendly and very obliging. The comference facilities are top class.  I'll be back.

name: roman polak
snippet: This was an imcredible dispapoint as me and family were to attend a booking made for 4pm and waited over two hours for a certain menu, we got served and ordered  by ignorant and not professional staff , we waited over 90 minutes for our food and a single glass of water for my pregnant wife and my diabetic mother in law!! The food we received was extremely cold and two dishes were forgotten about and never received!! We were served by atleast 5 or 6 waiters and waitresses that were all over the place! They never placed complimentary pieces to put tables salt .they were very understaffed and ignoran!!We waited 20 minutes for a single steak knife for a meal!! For A 4 STAR HOTEL IN GALWAY CITY THIS IS RIDICULOUSLY DISAPPOINTING AND FRUSTRATING we travelled all the way to enjoy a meal on a sunday evening and  received this below 1 star treatment !! I would definetly not recommend to anyone in the future!

name: Danielle Worth
snippet: Located a quick hop and jump from Eyre Square this is a great location. The hotel is beautiful and well maintained. Service was slow in the bar but if tour not in a hurry that is fine. The staff are accommodating and friendly. When the air conditioning did not work in our first room we were upgraded to a larger room with no cost. Very happy here.

name: Patrick L
snippet:
This isn’t a very good hotel. The problem is that they market it as a luxury spa hotel, but this doesn’t feel like a classy spa experience at all. The main problems are: (1) the air conditioning doesn’t really work. You wouldn’t think this would be a problem, but the sun comes in and the rooms roast. It looked like most people had their windows open which unfortunately means a ton of city noise. (2) the “spa” is across the street and consists of a pool, hot tub, steam room, and jacuzzi. They’re all pretty grungy and feels much, much more like a high school gym (right down to the broken lockers) than any sort of relaxing experience. You also won’t have robes and slippers by default so you’ll have to request those too. (3) the rooms are clean enough, strictly speaking, as-in we didn’t ever have a gross moment. That being said, there’s a lot of dust everywhere, everything is dated and old, and just a little beat up. Not a big deal, but again not the luxury spa experience they’re going for. (4) there’s construction going on. This may be a good thing if they’re trying to update things, but when it’s a few doors down and there’s loud drilling and music going on in the morning it’s not great.

The staff at the front was friendly, the location is awesome for arriving / departing / accessing the city, and the rooms were clean. This hotel should just be more upfront with what they are so you can plan accordingly.

name: Higgins Edel
snippet: My daughter and I had the most amazing day on Saturday in the Spa. We got two treatments each and were told we could stay as long as we wanted, in the relaxing rooms ( fresh fruit, tea and biscuits all complementary), the large indoor pool, the out door hot tub, sauna and my favorite the beach suite. I would highly recommend this Spa. I been to 5 star spas and I can tell you this was the best experience and service I have every got. All the staff were so professional and so nice and kind. They could not do enough for you. We were meant to go for two hours, we stayed for four and had the best mother and daughter day! I will defiantly be back!! Thank you all and especially Jade, it was such a relaxing treatment and your brilliant at what you do!

name: leanne brady
snippet: Staff in spa could not do enough. I had the best message with jade i think her name was and spent hours in thermal suites and pool.  Exceedingly good value for money especially when all staff are so friendly. Special thanks also to agnieska on reception for her wonderful welcoming attitude

name: Marco Pan
snippet:
If you work out, stay at the Galmont! The gyms were modern with above average equipment to choose from.

The rooms were also extremely modern, clean and comfortable. The bed was the best we’ve had and have been in Ireland at 4 other accommodations. We did not eat at the restaurant but it looked trendy and packed with people during a football game.

You are walking distance from one of the most beautiful parks that head down towards what seems like a lighthouse. You can go for a run and clear your mind in the best way possible here. The Galmont is a total rest and relaxing hotel to choose from!

name: Aoife Gallagher
snippet:
It's a nice hotel. Great location only less then 10 mins walk into the centre.
The one thing that I found kinda annoying was all the added extras, like parking 10e and the Spa was 15e for guests in my opinion should all be included in your stay.
The Spa - don't waste your time going to it. The thermal suite was a complete waste of time, it's basically 3 or 4 saunas that's it. Nothing special. The refreshments was ridiculous basically just water and a few apples.
I think this hotel is aimed more for families.
Our room was nice, basic. The actual room was boiling though.
We had food in the bar, which again was basic. Not much of a menu. Staff were slow even though the place was empty.
The only thing I thought that was really nice was the breakfast, huge choice and good for kids!!
Id come back as a family but wouldn't reccomend it for couples.

name: Eric Idler
snippet: At first glance, this hotel seems like a great experience. The lobby is very modern, and styled as such. However, the longer we stayed here the more things seem to be broken or damaged, these are small things with little overall impact but they add up. All of the employees are great, never had a bad experience with any of them.

name: ciara donnelly
snippet:
Second time here.....Fabulous room! Service was excellent this time! The breakfast manager couldn't have been more helpful with his help around their gluten free offerings. I had a delicious fully gluten free breakfast..very happy!!
The thermal suite is something. What a simply gorgeous way to spend an afternoon of pampering! The staff were superb. Couldn't be nicer and just such a relaxing vibe from the whole place. The products used are beautiful. I'm sold!

name: ten twenty
snippet:
Although it's one of the more costly hotels in the neighborhood, it was good for a one-night stopover and I don't think the price is justified. They don't effectively communicate that the "traditional" rooms lack air conditioning. They discriminate against people with disabilities by making their least expensive alternative the least expensive since the traditional rooms, which are also the least expensive, are quite difficult to access. We decided against eating breakfast at the marina since one of the waitresses was unfriendly and uncourteous, and the food looked quite bad. That's where I'd look.

If you exercise, get a room at the Galmont! There was top-notch equipment available in the contemporary gyms.

The rooms were also quite contemporary, spotless, and cozy. Even after staying at four different places in Ireland, the bed was the finest we've ever experienced. Although we didn't eat there, it was hip and crowded during a football game.

One of the most stunning parks that leads down to what seems to be a lighthouse is only a short stroll away. Here, you may run and get the most mental clarity imaginable. The Galmont is a very restful and tranquil hotel option!

name: Bernie
snippet: We had a lovely afternoon tea experience.  The food was very nice.

name: Rosie McCormack
snippet:
I have to say the Galmont is the nicest Hotel I have ever stayed. From the rooms to the food and the friendly staff it was amazing

Rooms: The rooms are so spacious and comfortable.

Walkability: Walking distance to the train station and eyre Square

Food & drinks: The food was amazing. Breakfast buffet was so nice and the bar food was so tasty. I could not fault any part of it

name: Michael Smith
snippet:
We booked this Hotel because there were no Marriot branded ones in Galway. We use the Bonvoy card and trust that brand. The Galmont is listed as a 5 star Hotel but I'd rate it a 3 or 4 tops. Our room had stains on the carpet, there were no USB charger outlets anywhere (I had to go into town and buy and adapter plug), the window didn't shut/lock properly, the bathroom was old & outdated, the tub was highly elevated (not good for older people), bathroom door had a big nail sticking out of the bottom, the wall base trim fit & finish looked like a apprentice put it up, and the hotel Decor looked 80-90's vintage.
The pool and hot tub availability was always full. I don't want to sit elbow to elbow with strangers.
The staff is the only saving grace of the Hotel- they are all friendly, helpful, and considerate. It's an ok hotel but not a 5 star by world standards.

name: Alan Beck
snippet:
Lovely hotel but 1 major fault from our stay, impossible to sleep! Room was located close to the function room and could hear every single song the band played while the whole room vibrated due to the bass. Kept us awake until it finished up at 2:30am.
Absolute disappointment. Will never return and could never recommend to anyone else as a result.

name: Eleanor Gormly
