snippet: Lovely clean room, great location, and an outstanding Irish breakfast buffet added up to a wonderful stay in Galway. Thanks to the helpful staff.

name: Constance Crafton
snippet:
The Galmont is supposed to be a four star hotel. It should be 1 star.

We stayed at The Galmont for two nights at a cost of just over 500.00 euros - my husband paid for an upgraded room. Check in was supposed to be 4 pm. We arrived about 3:44 and room was not ready. No worries, we were 15 minutes early.

Husband had to log into work. At 4:10, I asked about our room and was told engineering had to check to be sure AC worked. Our room was to be in the newly remodeled section. I asked for a quiet area for my husband to work. I was told there was no place available. They gave us two drink vouchers which we did not use.

At 4:30 I asked for a second time about a quiet place for my husband to take business calls. I was under the impression we were being led to a conference room. However, a reception worker led us to the sofas outside conference rooms where we quickly discovered there was a dance competition. Teenagers we’re back and forth and their coordinator was extremely loud.
When husband sat on the sofa, he discovered it was broken.  I had to shut conference room doors on the kids more than once.

We finally got our room at 5:30, I brought luggage up on a cart so husband could finish his work call.

Here is where it gets really interesting.

I took the elevator up and followed directions to our room. I felt like I was in The Shining - our room was at end of long hall which was a construction zone and felt abandoned: mattresses lined the hall, side walls still had spackle, it just was not ready for guests. I had to pull a mattress out of the way so I could get the luggage cart down hall. I’m still stunned they had a guest go down that hall!

Our room was at the very end of the hall.  I get there and it had a strong smell of paint. Husband comes up to room. He questioned whether I could stay there due to paint fumes being a migraine trigger. I said we’d have to stay since the hotel was fully booked. Then husband went to use the bathroom but the bathroom door wouldn’t close - it was hung wrong!

Remember, we waited 1.5 hours for engineering to verify ac worked? It did not: it started fine but a minute later posted an error; an engineer went to main environmental control to determine a fix. He returned and said it was no good. Room was simply not ready for guests.

7:05 pm Husband called reception desk to ask for new room but was told hotel is full. Husband makes second call and asks for supervisor. Tells supervisor we need another room or refund for us to go elsewhere. We were offered a bottle of red wine but we declined as we were miserable and had lost an evening in Galway.

Supervisor comes to room. We show him bathroom door doesn’t close, error on environmental controls, and drawers of desk don’t open. Supervisor seemed shocked at the state of our room.

Finally, the manager takes us to new room at 7:13 pm - 3 hours and 13 minutes past check in. Mgr offered bottle of Prosecco. I had lost patience and said how about dinner. He spoke of restaurant, I countered with room service - we just wanted to finally settle in for the night. Supervisor did comp room service for our dinner.

Overall, after nearly a month throughout Europe and Ireland, we had our worst hotel experience at the Galmont. It ruined our opinion of Galway and we were happy to leave for our next destination.

My recommendation: unless you are staying at the Galmont for a conference or competition, there are better options close by.

They severely overcharge for the quality of their rooms and service when compared to similarly priced accommodations in London, Amsterdam and multiple locations in Ireland. They were closest in quality to the AC Hotel in Belfast, which was significantly cheaper.

name: Shawn Kipp
snippet: Awesome stay Awesome place n service ..the only negative I got is the beds are super firm

name: Derek Sherman
snippet: Very nice accommodations.Fast and easy check in. Very nice and convenient in house restaurant serving up a great pizza as well as other snacks dishes.  This is a great place to use as your home base while checking out the Cliffs of Moher.  I do want to warn you the R roads in this neck of the woods are no joke. You will need a nice stiff drink once you get to the hotel.  Don't try one before or during the trip. Cheers!!

name: Colette Finucane
snippet:
Lovely hotel, very clean, the water stations on each floor is a great idea.
Dropped one star as the cooked breakfast was cold and the gluten free toaster didn't work.
However ordered omelette the following morning and it was delicious and piping hot. Food in Marina's restaurant was delicious. Great atmosphere in Cooper's bar with the piano playing.
Lovely views of the lough.
Overall I thoroughly enjoyed my 2 night stay and will definitely be back

name: Dympna Carroll
snippet:
Poor isn’t the word I want to use but, I don’t want to be rude either.
Myself and 15 guests had the worst service from this restaurant I’ve ever experienced, it ruined my night!
It took over an hour to get the starters!
The man course was cold.
If this was the only hotel left in Galway , I still wouldn’t go to it.
Keep your money and go to one of the other really good hotels that Galway offers, this one isn’t one of them

name: Teresa Ridge
snippet:
Was OK  the spa and thermal suite was fabulous had no treatments  .
But the swimming pool small and cold even the elderly felt it too .
The jacuzzi wasn't working very disappointing as no pressure at all.
Enjoy the outside hot tub  .so hopefully the jacuzzi be working and service to best standard and pool temperature more comfortable for swimming in the winter.

name: Derek Adams
snippet:
Had to change rooms due to noise from Gym below. Heating didn't work in the second room to the extent the windows misted up when you had a shower, the toilet and shower both leaked in second room. Breakfast seating manager refused us permission to sit where we wanted to on the second morning. The location is excellent but there are better located hotels. Not good value for money, very overrated.

Rooms: Don't stay in East Wing asked for a room in the West Wing. East Wing rooms are noisy and in need of being upgraded.

Food & drinks: Breakfast is really good plenty to select from and it is kept well topped up. You have to ask for the poached eggs bit they are lovely. Pancakes were hard.

name: Marie O'Sullivan
snippet: Fantastic night at their Christmas party. Food was delicious. Music was great. Every one was bopping the night away. Service at the bar was a little slow but that may be down to low staff levels but hey we weren't going anywhere anyway.

name: PJ Kelly
snippet: Great location. 5 mins from centre of town. Lovely staff. Great breakfast. Very comfortable room. Spotless.

name: michael kan
snippet: We stayed at the Galmont Hotel and Spa in October. The staff was helpful and kind.  The photographer or marketer for the hotel has a wonderful eye and makes this place appear far grander than it is. It’s basically a conference hotel with little class or style. The rooms are average in size, but the furnishings are well worn. Our room had a chair that you nearly fell through as it was severely worn in the middle. The towels were thin and felt like sandpaper. The pillows were flat and hard. The hot was nearly nonexistent.  Their breakfast buffet was horrible. It lacked fresh food, contained fruit which was browned and eggs that were cold. Finally, the walls were incredibly thin and you could hear everything going on in the next room as well as the hallway. And trust me, there was a lot going on in the next room – wink. Do yourself a favor and book a room at the Hardiman.

name: Liana M
snippet:
We could not find a brighter light in our room. Felt sleepy    and we were meant to get ready for event. Other than that all good, clean and comfortable.
No shower cap was available in the bathroom. Food was good, no other extra choices, wokld be same as any other hotel. No wow factor! But staff was extremely lovely, thank you

name: James Conn
snippet:
Fantastic hotel in the centre of Galway. Walking distance to the Latin Quarter and Eyre Square.
Rooms are very good and comfortable, only downside is it’s pricey but worth it.

name: AnnMarie Walsh
snippet: It was the ATU graduation, it was packed. No comfort moving around. Might not be a big enough location for graduation.

name: Shauna Ryan
snippet: Went to the spa and it was lovely. Then came up for lunch as I had a voucher. I had ordered a burger my mum ordered a wrap. They first came out with two wraps and I had to tell them I had ordered a burger. We were sitting there for an hour by the time I got my burger in front of me. The chips were cold so had to return them. The supervisor was very nice and offered us complementary desserts as well as taking the burger off the bill. Before I even got my dessert or our last drinks, the waitress came running down with our bill and made us pay??? Never had to do that in any restaurant or hotel. One staff lady was so rude. The food was lovely but service was not the best

name: Samantha Winterburn
snippet: Honestly less than impressed with a pretty expensive hotel experience. The elevators were broken half the weekend, the cleaning crew never replaced the coffee/tea on the bar, and the soiled linen bags were left in the hallways practically all day. For over $230/night it was not super impressive in the details.

name: Kestutis Semaska
snippet:
We visited this hotel for the first time. We stayed two nights and chose the cheapest option offered with breakfast.  Because the room was the cheapest, it was at the other end of the building. But it was a very quick walk to the SPA, only a longer distance to the restaurant and bar, but it wasn't a problem for us. Unfortunately, if you arrive with a car, you will have to pay 10€ per night for parking.
The room is tidy with a very, very large bed. The hotel staff was very nice and polite.  For breakfast there was a lot of different food which was very tasty and also a variety of coffee, tea and juice.
For dinner at the restaurant, we chose a 4-course menu (€90 for two) with a bottle of wine and were also surprised by the good quality and delicious food.
The main SPA has a swimming pool, jacuzzi, two different saunas and an outdoor hot tub. Don't forget to have 1€ with you, it is needed in the locker. Also, if you want to swim in the pool, you will need a swimming cap (you can buy it at the entrance for €3)
If that wasn't enough you can go to The Thermal Suite at the Spirit One Spa for an additional fee (€15 per person as a hotel resident). It has an artificial beach with real sand where you can lie down and relax, as well as 4 different saunas and HEATED RELAXATION LOUNGERS.
After these pleasures, you can relax in the dedicated room where you can enjoy with cup off coffee, tea and fruits.

•HEATED RELAXATION LOUNGERS
Heated to a comfortable 36°C and designed in an ergonomic shape to offer your body the most relaxed position it can take.
•THE LACONIUM
Offers a dry, gentle heat in a more relaxed environment, with scented citrus oils and gentle light therapy.
•EXPERIENCE SHOWERS
Three showers, offering between them essential oils and water in the form of invigorating tropical rain and a light cool mist to refresh your mind and body between cabins.
•THE ROCK SAUNA
This is the hottest and driest of our thermal experiences at 85°C to 90°C, ideal for swift detoxification and invigoration.
•SABIA MED
Explore the wonders of the Sabia med or "beach" as it is better known to our guests, taking you through a meditative dawn to dusk light cycle whilst lying on a warm tropical beach.

name: Natasha Quirke
snippet: Arrived and checked in but our room was not ready so the staff were kind enough to give us a drink in the bar while we waited. I couldn't rate this hotel more highly. The staff were fantastic and the food was amazing. The room was comfy and had everything we needed. I would defiantly look forward to a visit in the future.

name: Sam M
snippet:
I wouldn’t say this place is beautiful. It was fine. It has its own garage which is what mattered to us.

During check out, the elevator to the garage level was out of order. We were told it would be fixed in a few minutes or we could walk one flight of stairs down with all our luggage. We chose the latter. On our way out of the garage, some person! decided to walk his luggage through the garage entrance. No pedestrians were allowed through there since there was a blind curve. We almost hit him.  I guess he was too lazy to walk down the stairs.

The pool/spa is located in an adjacent building. I wouldn’t say it’s across the street, since the street is a dead end. You can stay on the curb and cross the garage entrance then you are there. Our issue with the pool was that we were required to buy and use a head cap to cover our heads/hair. It wasn’t a nice pool. Looked more like a school pool than a fancy spa pool.

Breakfast. We didn’t understand why there was even a host during breakfast. The person kept missing so many people, who just sat themselves, when they were busy seating other people.

3.5 stars.

name: Kathleen Markey
snippet: This is the best hotel i have stayed in in Ireland. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are very clean and to have a fridge in the room was a pleasant bonus. We ate in both restaurant's and the food was delicious. Full marks for a very pleasant stay and will definatly be back

name: Aidan McCarthy
snippet: We stayed two nights and had a wonderful time. The location was ideal, the rooms were comfortable, and the staff was hospitable and courteous. The room service was also excellent. Despite the fact that we had not yet eaten lunch or dinner, we had breakfast in bed twice, and I personally prefer cold breakfast to hot.

name: Ultan Guilfoyle
snippet: Nice rooms, great location. Don't get breakfast in bed. Heated up food, didn't get what we ordered and left a whole breakfast out of the order (only 2 of us staying)

name: Terri Griffin
snippet:
We stayed here three nights on a breakfast and one night dinner package. The beds are very comfortable with good linens and towels. They need outlets on both sides of the bed though. It’s frustrating when you can’t plug in next to the bed.

We didn’t have time to try the spa but we did eat breakfast there each morning in the Marina which is also where we had Easter dinner. Food was average and a little overpriced . Breakfast wasn’t until 8am. We wouldn’t recommend the breakfast package as there are many cafes nearby. It’s expansive and we don’t eat enough to make it worth it.

We also ate dinner and had drinks in their Coopers bar and lounge which has a separate dining area.

The hotel Is expensive but it was nice. I think that makes more sense if you want a spa type holiday where you use more of the amenities. If we were to replan our holiday we would have only stay here one or two nights and stay in local places as we drive the coast. Just depends on what you are looking for

name: Kamla Kasichainula
snippet: Lovely hotel In a really convenient location in Galway. Could hear people in the hallway kind of loudly, and the elevators were quite slow... One was broken. I was lucky to be on the first floor and could take stairs without it being too much of a problem. Service was great, they had places to fill up water on every floor, and it wasn't super pricy. Def recommend if you come to Galway.

name: Eugene
snippet: Very conveniently situated hotel within walking distance of the train and all main attractions in Galway town. Very comfortable rooms and helpful staff.

name: Mike Ramsey
snippet: This is probably one of the nicest hotels with large facilities, restaurant, bar, and general sitting area. This hotel has one of the best spa and workout facilities we have utilized rivaling most stateside gyms. A good selection of restaurants are just a 2 block walk away and taxis are easily obtained.

name: N Dunne
snippet: I could not find fault with the hotel. Best location. Beside train station minutes to eyre square. Very welcoming staff. All staff were friendly helpful nothing too much trouble. Even at breakfast when the had 400 guests to cater for. If your going to Galway it’s the hotel.   Rooms recently renovated. Excellent spa.

name: Cynthia K
snippet: It was not the standard I was expecting based on how much we paid to stay here for 3 nights.  To make matters worse, one of the elevators was out but no one at the front desk could set any expectations around that.   Overall, I’m giving them a low score because of the lack of communication.  We had breakfast in the Marina’s restaurant twice and that was not a pleasant experience and most of it self-serve so interaction with the staff should have been minimal.  I witnessed waiters wiping off tables with dirty rags and not doing a good job.  I literally had to ask for the table to be wiped again.  I understand that everyone is busy but I’m talking more about basic training.  For example, it took 4 times to ask for cream with our coffee.  It took 3 visits to the kitchen to finally get enough coffee for the three of us who were drinking it.  It was frustrating to say the least.  It was quite bizarre to watch our waiter go back to the kitchen and come back with just one cup and then return to kitchen to get two more.   The food was decent for a hotel breakfast Buffett but overall, there is just an energy of chaos.  Checking was also chaotic.  It two people to finally figure out that somehow, my room was double booked.  I was with a party of friends and they mixed our rooms up so the amenities I ordered ended up in another person’s room.  Eventually things got figured out but it took much direction from me to make that happen.  Overall, I had a sense of “no one was in charge”.  Maybe we just caught the staff in a bad week but I wouldn’t stay here again.  There is just too many options to choose from to deal with the confusion.

name: Shauna
snippet: This hotel is a really nice hotel located just off Eyre Square. Accessible to everything. Lovely rooms, we had a fridge and got complimentary cartons of water and a coffee machine and all. Huge TV in the room as well. Really comfortable. The leisure centre and outdoor hot tub were amazing! The staff were very nice and accommodating. Only big downside to this hotel is the fact that you have to PAY for PARKING. We payed over €700 in this hotel between accommodation, food & drink etc, yet at check out we were still handed a bill of €9 per night for just simple parking the car. I personally think this is a really low blow from the hotel, if you’re going to charge high enough rates to customers, parking should be included/free. That would honestly turn me away from returning as I feel it’s just very unfair. Just unfortunate as there was nothing else to fault.

name: Alexandra
snippet:
Overall, we enjoyed our stay at The Galmont and would return. The beds were SO comfortable, rooms were spacious, and the hotel is lovely. Staff were very friendly. We were in what seemed like the farthest room possible from the lobby - when we looked out our window we could actually see the lobby/elevators across the lot. We got a good laugh at that and enjoyed our quiet east wing of the hotel. The hotel is located less than a 5 min walk from the train station, and not too far from the main part of the city.
Some issues we encountered, which is why I left off one star: (1) Money disappearing from our room. We had roughly 12 euro in coins (for bus fare) on the table in our room. We left the coins there while we did a 10hr guided tour as the coins were cumbersome to carry. When we returned and the money was gone, we called and reported it. We informed them that perhaps housekeeping thought it was a tip, but we needed the money for bus fare. They said they would investigate but we seemingly did not hear back. If they called while we were out, no message was left on the hotel phone, our cell phone was not called, and there was no mention of it at check out. (2) The classic rooms do not have air conditioning and the room became quite stuffy. To compensate, we kept the window open and used the provided fan. (3) Dangerous bathtub/shower combo. The bathtub is rounded inside and is very tall. This made it difficult to keep your footing, especially when exiting, as you had a far way to step out and down. They did provide a non slip bath mat but the tub was generally uncomfortable to use for this reason. (4) This is a small thing…my husband got a sudden migraine in the middle of eating dinner. He ran back to the room because he becomes physically ill with migraines. We hadn’t touched our main course yet so I asked the restaurant if they could box our food to bring to the room. While our waiter was very nice, all he offered was to wrap the plates in tin foil for me to carry to my room. As mentioned earlier, we were very far from the lobby so I had to navigate elevators, long hallways, and opening a hotel door with two very heavy plates in my hands. At a 4 star hotel I just would’ve expected someone to lend a quick helping hand for a sick guest.

name: Christopher Walsh
snippet:
My wife and I spent two nights at The Galmont and had a wonderful experience. The close proximity to downtown Galway along with the comfortable accommodations, friendly staff, and good food made for an outstanding stay.

Rooms: Clean and comfortable.

Walkability: Easy walk to train and to town.

name: Michael Gelkov
snippet:
Nice room and beautiful view to the sea.
Paying like 200e per night and charging us 9e per day for parking is ridiculous.
Room service was bad. Nobody is taking care of the room for towels, beds etc.
Furthermore I was really disappointed from the bar.
We went at the bar for a drink at 10.50 because we knew that the last round of orders is at 11 since we were informed at the reception. They did not allow us and told us that we can drink at the lobby. We have accepted that but around 11.15 they allowed to some guys to have drinks at the restaurant and they even took their order...
Overall is good but a bit overpriced for the service they are providing.
P.S. I forgot to add the fact that for the spa you have to pay 10e. It is just the swimming pool and the jacuzzi that is free.

name: Philip Gilmartin
snippet: The Galmont is a beautiful hotel. We stayed on a Saturday night, we didn't have dinner but the breakfast was fantastic. The bar on Saturday night was busy and there was a man playing the piano and singing. We had a great night, the staff in the bar are so friendly. The staff at reception couldn't do enough for us and you feel welcome as soon as you walk in. We used the pool on Sunday morning and it was the perfect finish to our stay. I will definitely be staying here again.

name: Catherine McGrath
snippet: Luv it, great location, great view from our Room, staff were wonderful, food great, definitely have to go back spring, summer

name: Eva O'Donohoe
snippet:
The Spirit One Spa

Serendipity doesn’t even come to describe it! I booked a spontaneous spa day. From the moment I made contact with Ann to the spa package with orla and all the other staff in the spa, I was treated like royalty. It was a fantastic deal and I would go every week if I could. Absolutely recommend!

name: Carey Kaiser
snippet: Was fine for stopping in for one night but is one of the more expensive hotels in the area and I don’t think it’s worth the price. The “classic” rooms don’t have AC which they don’t advertise well. Also the classic rooms, which are also the lowest cost, are extremely hard to get to - so they are kind of discriminating against those with disabilities by making their lowest cost option the cheapest. One of the servers in the marina for breakfast was rude and not welcoming and the food looked pretty disgusting so we didn’t end up eating there. I’d look elsewhere

name: HEATHER EUSTICE
snippet: Would definitely stay here again, it was amazing

name: Sarah Melanie
snippet: I would 100% recommend this hotel to others visiting Galway. The room was beautiful and clean and the staff were friendly and attentive. Also, the location was perfect what we needed. We were right next to the Galway train station, while also within a five minute walk to the city center.

name: robby thomas
snippet:
When we looked for a place online, this place seemed to have it all.   4 stars, spa, good location in city, ac on the rooms listed.

As we went to book on the company website we ran into an issue.   As we were trying to sort we found them on booking.com and  it let us quickly book.

We show up and they have a convention staying at the hotel.   Spa completely booked up, our room is a classic and per them does not have ac.

They brought up a fan that does not work to help.   So now we are looking to find another place to stay at tomorrow as this location was a total let down on what has been an epic Ireland vacation.

Would not recommend staying here.

name: Erjaldo Ibraj
snippet: Im very disappointed in my stay . First of all i was woken up at 8am by builders above us drilling and hammering. There was no signs etc to inform this would be happening. Second the rooms were very hot , our air conditioning was broken. The spa was very disappointing too. Very limited facilities. (The jacuzzi wasnt working)

name: Daniel Purcell
snippet:
The decor of the hotel was gorgeous, rooms are lovely. Unfortunately the staff are just all over the place. Expect major delays in the most simple request. Avoid Coopers food food - not good. Marinas restaurant on the other hand is a 10/10. Phenomenal.

The Spa is the best part of the hotel. The staff were incredible, the amenities are great although it’s slightly over priced.

To be fair when things went wrong management acted quickly and made it right.

I would visit again.

name: Saoirse Bradley
snippet:
I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights. The food was nice however they didn't display their vegetarian options on the menu. You had to ask. The breakfast was a bit mediocre, like you'd find it in any other cheaper hotel. The bar was good apart from being obviously understaffed. All the extra amenities were fantastic like the spa, gym and pool. House keeping was non existent. We were told on arrival that there would be no cleaning or servicing of the room each day due to COVID-19. I know that this is not true. These hotels have policies of cleaning the rooms and changing the linen every two days, the COVID-19 excuse was just to cover up that they had booked too many rooms and did not have the staff to clean them all. The hotel is extremely understaffed and it is so obvious.
The poor girl that was serving us drinks one night was run off here feet. She told us she had to serve the whole lounge and terrace by herself.
Several of the lights in our room were not working. The room itself was tiny for what we were paying. We were not given new towels everyday or even every other day. We had to go down to reception to ask for more. Overall for a four star hotel our room was small and ugly, there was no house keeping, and we basically had to clean the room ourselves. I've had better service in hostels. Not worth the money we payed. The hotel has no sense of luxury at all once you get past the lounge and bar area. Honestly we went here for a romantic getaway and it was very disappointing.

name: Anthia Taylor
snippet: Took my sister to the spa for a mini facial,  back, neck and shoulder massage. We also had an hour in the thermal suite. It was so relaxing. And Chloe who did my treatments, was amazing! She was professional, she listened to what I wanted and she delivered. Thank you Chloe for making my experience so amazing. And to all the staff in the SPA you guys are absolutely brilliant and so friendly and helpful. A wonderful experience , so thank you all.

name: Ann CONLON
snippet:
Beautiful hotel to have stayed in 100% all round

Walkability: Just afew mins from the City

Food & drinks: Drink were lovely food was alright Breakfast was amazing

name: R McSweeney
snippet: Staff very poor in restaurant and breakfast. We were waiting 20 mins and no one asked if we wanted tea or anything from the menu. We had a meal in restaurant the night before and they got order wrong asked for salmon and they arrived with chicken. When I complained nothing was done about it not even a sorry. Staff are so badly trained just walking around doing nothing to look busy. Very poorly kept hotel rooms. elevators and stairs could do with a good clean buttons floor of elevator filthy. And they charge you €10 a night to use their own car park. Worst hotel I’ve stayed in for a very long time. 4 star hotel 1 star service.

name: TheRory79
snippet: Really enjoyed my stay and the staff were friendly. I knocked a star because of breakfast (was advised not to take it and eat out) and waiting on a round that didn't come and was incorrect. But they were apologetic and looked after it. The room was nice and we had a great view of the bay. Leisure centre was nice outside hot tube pity the steam room was out of action.

name: Rebecca Treacy
snippet: Amazing stay in the Galmont. The staff are what make the hotel - so welcoming and friendly. From check in with Clodagh, to the bar manager ensuring we had every thing we needed during dinner, I cant say enough good things! Breakfast was fab too. We especially enjoyed our time in the outdoor hot tub and cant wait to come back!

name: Emma Corr
snippet:
Me and my boyfriend stayed here for our anniversary and we couldn’t fault the hotel at all. All the staff were lovely & helpful. On arrival we were told we had been upgraded to the superior king room. The room was amazing and very clean, it even had a balcony.
The spa and pool were great also.
Only thing we were upset about was staying just one night. Will definitely be back again for a longer stay!

name: Damo butt
snippet:
Fab hotel, we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Spotlessly clean, Food excellent, breakfast fab. Room and facilities were excellent just 1 problem the pillows were too soft for me even with getting an extra 1. The bed was so comfy.
To the entire staff well done and top marks ye were so friendly its a credit to the hotel management should be proud of ye , the guys in the leisure centre well done so polite and friendly too.
The hotel is nicely situated in the city centre which I liked.
I have 3 matters that should be addressed in my opinion.
The hotel had excellent covid policys in place, but lacked where a small percentage of customers were not wearing masks while walking around the hotel public areas, this needs addressing.
2. the car parking is a bit pricey for guest at the hotel, yes I know its a city car park but it is the hotel car park which makes a difference 9e a night is a bit of a rip off im sorry to say.
3. information on the hotels covid procedures for the room hygine policy should be displayed in the rooms just so the guest knows that the rooms are not cleaned for ur stay and that you have to ring for towels etc for the room.
Other than that an excellent hotel and will be back, but with my own pillow.

name: Rudy LLana
snippet:
Room Service sub par. Ordered sodas Waited an hour before canceling the drinks. After calling and canceling. The waiter shows up 15 minutes later.
A/C not running throughout the night had to turn off and on to get it going. Could be management controlled.

name: mark
snippet:
I didn't stay but I attended a 4 day conference there. I would highly recommend the service

Safety: The Bar Staff are exceptionally friendly and Professional

Walkability: A few mins walk from the heart of the City Centre

name: Maria Begley
snippet:
Stayed for two nights in a seaview room. The hotel is beautifully decorated and our room was spotless. The views from our room was stunning.
The hotel is walking distance from Eyre Square. Parking is paid, but hotel guests receive a reduced rate.
We had afternoon tea for two and would highly recommend it to others. The treats were delicious and there was a great selection of teas.
Spirit One Spa is also a must if you stay here.
Would absolutely recommend to others to stay here and will definitely return.

name: marie Smyth
snippet: fab hotel, great location.  we will be back

name: Glenn Davis
snippet: Very relaxing stay here for the bank holiday! Staff are excellent and coopers bar and food is sensational. Spirited One spa was the particular highlight with the thermal suites but the general ambience of the hotel puts you at ease, being away from the hustle and bustle of the Galway night life yet not too far that if you wanted to join it was a trek

name: raymob
snippet:
Ate in the restaurant and had a drink in the bar.
Friendly staff, very clean and great location. Minutes walk from Galway city centre.

name: Poppy Murray
snippet:
Lovely rooms, very comfortable and the hotel is beautiful.

We visited in the lull after the pandemic restrictions had been lifted and whilst we loved the hotel we found the service to be lacklustre.

The pool is lovely, definitely worth a trip!

name: Glen Murphy
snippet:
Beautiful hotel close to the water and close to the city centre. It has a really nice spa and fitness centre.
Their buffet breakfast was very good.

name: Laura Higgins
snippet:
I found the staff very helpful, but not knowledgeable .    When I asked about walking tours or if there was a hop on hop off bus in the city, the staff member didn't know and apologized. The literature at the front door didn't have anything about the city other than a map that gave information about where to eat. Nothing about the Galway City and it's history.  Lots of information about the count Galway and other counties.
The menu in the restaurant and bar were very limited.
We asked for a twin room and were given a double room.
The view from the room was a roof full of weeds and beyond the river, nothing brag about.
The soap containers were very difficult to squeeze as we both have arthritis in our hands.  We had to buy soap.
The swimming pool was lovely.

name: Stephi Mulvany
snippet: The staff are so helpful and nice, nothing was too much trouble. They facilitated an early check in which was brilliant as I was graduating from college and wanted to get ready. The room itself was lovely, the bed was HUGE and very comfortable. Getting food was easy even though I am a ceoliac, the food for breakfast, lunch and dinner was excellent. We'll definitely be back! Thank you!!

name: James Burns
snippet: Nice hotel, great food. Staff were superb. Bit disappointing that the car park is extra at this price point though

name: Jerry M
snippet: One of two lifts were not functioning initially, and then the second one broke down. The regular stairway did not go all the way to the top floor where my room was located, although an emergency stairway was opened up when both lifts were out of order. What was otherwise a good enough experience was seriously marred for most of the stay by all the very tedious queuing and waiting for the single lift. It was a relief to finally be able to use the stairs.

name: Blake Heslep
snippet: We stayed here when passing though Galway to the visit the cliffs of Moher. We are incredibly grateful for George and the team at Galmont for pulling strings to accept our late night reservation request when all other hotels were fully booked. It is acts of kindness like this that touch our hearts and make traveling across the world meaningful. If it was not for George, we likely would have slept on the street. May god bless these lands

name: Karen Rotella
snippet:
Enjoyed everything about this hotel. The rooms were quite large.

Nearby activities: Close to the center of town.

name: Derek Harte
snippet: Nice hotel. 10 min walk from Eyre square. Great gym and pool. My issues were around the poor communication with my upgrade request (I asked for something on 3 separate emails and they still missed it) and also the fact that the noise from a wedding below was pretty bad. We were on the 4th floor and could easily still hear the music from the afters of a wedding below.

name: Evie E
snippet: Gorgeous hotel, great location. The staff were all so friendly despite being very busy. Parking for the night was €8. The spa was nice but the changing room situation is a bit weird, you have to go up to the gym to change and pay €1 for the locker, so lots of traipsing around before you can relax.

name: Andrey Klochko
snippet: the service exceeded all our expectations.  felt like the president and first lady!

name: Maja Hm
snippet: Next to the  rail station. They put me in a room next to theventilation station, no chance of any sleep. Had to change the room. Brekfast ok, bread stale. Spa mediocre. Hygine medicre. Staff ok, specially Indian managers. Will not come back.

name: John Keane
snippet: Great staff, very nice rooms, delicous food and decent gym and pool. Would highly recommend

name: Elie Shaccour
snippet:
Went on a 2 night vacation to the Galmont. Overall it's a good place, but I didn't like the following.
1) We booked a king size bedroom. The bed was actually a 2*double bed and so huge.
2) The bed didn't have a headrest. The wooden back was actually the headrest which was soo annoying.
3) The bed had only 4 pillows which were not comfortable. 4 star hotels are known for having comfortable pillows but this didn't.

If you enjoy a good rest/sleep, on a comfortable bed then I wouldn't recommend Galmont.

On a positive note, staff was exceptional and very friendly(especially breakfast staff), indoor swimming pool and jacuzzi were great.

name: Joe Crean
snippet: Recently attended a wedding showcase at the Galmont, the management and staff went above and beyond to make both wedding suppliers and prospective clients feel welcome, looking forward to shooting weddingschere in the near future it's location is in close proximity to some of Galways beauty spots.

name: Ann Marie O'Connell
snippet:
We stayed at the Galmont NYE for our one year wedding anniversary. I cannot thank Jacinta and the team for the warm welcome.

The room was absolutely beautiful and they even left a bottle of bubbles and handwritten card for us on arrival.

We had an amazing meal in coppers bar and could not fault it. The cocktails were also incredible. ( Shout out to Mary the night manager who arranged nibbles up to the room)

For anyone considering a night away in the heart of Galway I would highly recommend. This hotel has everything you need with amazing staff to top it all off!!

Just a quick mention to Hiya events who were mc'n for NYE,they were fantastic!!!

One last mention to Jacinta, you are an asset to the hotel ❤️

Ann Marie and Alan Flannelly
31st December 2022

name: Neeraj Rajput
snippet:
This is one of the best place to stay in Galway.

Walkability: It's at the best location. Everything is available at a walking distance.

Food & drinks: This category has lot of space for improvement.

name: ronan keenan
snippet:
We came out of the Train station and 2 mins later we were at the Hotel.

We arrived at 12.30 and check in was 3pm.They allowed us to check in straight away. This makes a huge difference and allowed us to drop our bags and go straight out and enjoy our day instead of hanging around to check in.

The girl at the desk was really friendly ,helpful ,chatty and you felt she really cared about giving you the very best and Warmest care for our stay.

The Room was cool but with a good working air con that could be easily adjusted.The bed was huge and Comfy , though the Pillows needed to be fuller as they felt very flat. The Bathroom clean tidy and shower easy to use. Overall the room was very comfortable.

After being out for the whole day in the cool Salthill wind we arrived back to the hotel where we found a fabulous fire  that lured us to have a night cap at the bar . The Piano was being played and set a lovely ambience. The barman was still chatty and smiling despite being late in the day.

Breakfast was open until 11am meaning you didnt have to be up too early to enjoy. This place was packed with a continuous flow of people .There didnt look like there was a table free but the Lovely charming chap that brought us in found one with ease,  always confident there would be one available .
Breakfast was a well oiled machine in this place. I went up to the buffet and by the time i returned to my table the coffee had been ordered and on the table ready. Sublime service. All the usual breakfast choices readily available as well as the staff if there were any special orders.  No panicking or rushing around by the staff for such a busy time just smiling happy and efficient .Tables cleaned and ready in seconds to an impeccable standard.

At Check out we were greeted again with a warm greeting.Swift efficient and well wishes for our travels.

The staff make this place.Through hard work , warm welcomes and top level efficiency we are definitely going back again.

Well Done you should all be Very Very Proud of yourselves  for the work you do daily.

name: Daniel Ahern
snippet:
loved our Stay at the Galmont.
Staff were great.
Location was Great.
Food was Very good.
Breakfast was Very good.
if we were staying again we would request a room at the back away from the main road traffic during the night.

name: Nora Flynn
snippet:
Fabulous spot, wonderful restaurant. My only reservation was we could not get the room to cool off...and the pillows were not a favorite.
Find the wine bar called The Lane down by the Aran Sweater Market(also a place to get to...1/3 the price you pay in the States for an Aran...and free shipping). She has a wonderful selection of wines and whips up delicious mini or large chacuterie boards! It is a tiny spot...and you can do reservations. We happened on it about 530pm...and she said we could have a spot...but there was a reservation for 730pm. I assured her we could reach the proper level of "smashed" within the alotted time...and taxis are very near.
One of our best surprise finds
12/10!

name: Venkatasubramanian Neelakantan
snippet: I stayed in the Galmont for 2.5 months. It was an wonderful experience in total. All the staff members were very kind and polite. I even caught COVID during my stay. The hotel staff made it very easy and smooth. Overall a wonderful experience and a great place to stay. This place is highly recommended for stay.

name: marie costelloe
snippet: Just had a lovely stay in the Galmont Hotel. Great food, great location and staff were so nice and helpful. Would recommend a stay there if you are in the Galway area

name: Jackie Breen
snippet: Could not praise the staff here enough.  Everyone was extremely helpful and professional.  The hotel is lovely, sitting in a Riverside location with excellent road access and an easy to use car park. I was at a conference and it all ran very smoothly. We'll done to all involved.

name: Florence Bass
snippet: I got a warm welcome from the gentleman on the front desk on arrival. In the current climate I felt very safe, the hotel is very well organised. My room which looked down on the Corrib was immaculate,the bed was very comfortable - loved the pillows ! The food in the restaurant & the lounge was delicious. The staff all over the hotel were helpful & very polite.

name: Sinead Farrell
snippet: We had a lovely 1 night stay myself and a friend rooms were spotless food was nice location was perfect. Disadvantages were the charge for the carpark even though we were residents.  The outside hot tub was not working which was the reason I booked this hotel. Staff were average not very friendly, all business not very personal experience.  Queues for check out were ridiculous.

name: ant “Anto” cal
snippet: Went here for work Xmas party - one of the worst meals I've ever had put in front of me and waiting staff that were either untrained or painfully indifferent. More like being at Butlins than a four star hotel. Same for bar staff - woefully inexperienced or just not well managed. Deffo will not be going back to the Galmont

name: Barry Fitzpatrick
snippet:
Was here for a 2 day wedding.  Excellent in every aspect.  Such a well run wedding with superb food.  Could not fault.   Love clean room for our 2 nights stay. And what can I say about the breakfast selection
Best I've ever had and I've had quite a few.

name: Anthony Hegarty
snippet: This was the first weekend of opening after lockdown so it was a different experience than it would normally be. Based on that it was still a good stay. The staff were very friendly and coped well with dealing with social distancing, keeping everywhere clean etc. The food mostly very good, except breakfast food was a bit cold. The room was very comfortable and a nice size. It is in a good location, a couple of minutes walk from city centre. Would definitely recommend the hotel and look forward to returning when everything gets back to normal.

name: Hemant Kumar
snippet: Good restaurant, good room, good breakfast, all in budget, near to station. Cons: the road to hotel from staion is just 300 m but it's often very quite, so be alert while reaching hotel by walking

name: Kate Harris
snippet: 2 hours to get room service, no apology for forgetting us. Ordered 2 drinks charged for both but only received one, didn't receive our breakfast after the second night, took €5 off our bill for these problems. Room was lovely though.

name: Allen Whisler
snippet:
The rooms were very nice and the hotel has tons of high-end amenities.  It is just a short walk to the center of the old city and the Spanish arch.

Noteworthy details: The spa offers a lot of different experiences and is worth checking out!

name: carly mucha
snippet:
Went to the Spa and got a 120 minute hot stone massage. I have to say, I was really disappointed. The pressure was so light the entire time   . I don’t even want a very hard massage, but with the pressure I got I honestly didn’t feel relaxed and I don’t think there were any therapeutic benefits.I was wondering when the massage was about to start.

The thermal suite was nice-although a bit tacky. I’d prefer less coloured flashing lights and more classical rooms like the steam room. The showers were broken (the steam portion broken) and need to be updated.

The pool upstairs was ok-although when I went there were screaming kids which was disappointing. I work a lot and wanted some quiet alone time. Both hot tubs were literally lukewarm.

Used the float tub as well and it was lovely, although also lukewarm.

Moving from Canada, I’m actually cold in Ireland all the time. Housing (and even workspaces) here don’t have central heating, so it’s taken a lot to adjust to feeling freezing cold all the time and seeing my breath indoors, and not having a bathtub in my rental.

So I was hoping to treat myself and warm up at Spirit One. The hot tubs were really disappointing as was the lukewarm float tub. I just wanted to feel warm for once, and sadly didn’t.

I enjoyed being able to relax in the lounge and the thermal suite for a few hours, so those were somewhat redeeming qualities.

name: Chirag Malhotra
snippet: Dint liked the service at all. though good place but not at all a 4 star hotel. it was a bit turn off to what was charged and services offered. food was bad. they gave soup without spoon for hrs and then when asked the got it after a while till then soup turned cold. Room services wasn't done until I asked in evening. One day we took take away can't imagine the packing worst I have ever seen they packed scones over chicken and other scone over ham and cheese sandwich (lacks basic understanding) could have packed scones together and sandwiches together.      Bad experience... on one to take responsibility too.

name: Brendan Farrell
snippet:
Joined the gym and pool on an annual membership, great facility, clean and well maintained. I've been a member over the years and really find it the best leisure facility Galway has to offer under one roof.

Noteworthy details: Leisure facilities are A1 and staff are all great to deal with

name: Paul Bannon
snippet:
Enjoyed our stay at the Galmont. We had a large room on the child free fifth floor.
The hotel was operating under strict Covid regulations but coped well.
There was only outside dining in Galway City so we ate in the hotel each evening. The food and service was to a high standard.
The room was spotless, the large bed was very comfortable.
Clodagh at reception was a star.
The hotel is nice and central although we had to pay to use the hotel car park.

name: Anonymous
snippet: Avoid the Terrance outdoor dining area. Service is painfully slow even though it was not overly busy, cocktail menu is cut down to two options, anyone with a food allergy can forget about getting food because any options they claim to have they will be out of on the day even when notified in advance of dietary requirements. Some members of our party had to wait forty minutes for their food after everyone else at the table had finished eating. It was next to impossible to get the attention of staff for drinks or menus. Extremely disappointing as I have stayed in the hotel before so had expected great things only to be let down.

name: Aisling Henry
snippet: Afternoon tea was excellent, all the lovely staff were so welcoming and helpful. We went to the Spa and the girls were amazing, so accommodating and couldn't do enough for us. We'll definitely be back again!

name: Frances Lehane
snippet: Fabulous location 7mins walk from Eyre Square. Staff attentive and friendly.  Leisure facilities top class, children friendly. Bar well stocked food excellent. Will definitely return.

name: Shannon
snippet: Came here for our anniversary and would not recommend at all. The woman checking us in yesterday didn’t know what she was doing, the other man working along side her had checked in 3 different couples before she was finished with us. The service for dinner was extremely slow. The wrong food and drinks were offered to us 3 different times, you could tell not one of the staff members knew what was going on and where anything was going..  the quality of the food for what you pay is very poor. We were almost charged for 2 bottles of wine on checkout too that apparently were brought up to our room even though we didn’t have anything delivered to the room! Air con in the room wasn’t working and the bathroom is absolutely tiny! Only good thing about the hotel is the outdoor hot tub…

name: Sinead C Kavanagh
snippet:
Lovely private dinner overlooking Lough Atalia. Food was beautiful, service was great and staff were so attentive. Highly recommended

Walkability: Right in the city centre. Easily accessible to all amenities and shopping.

Food & drinks: Beautiful food, presented elegantly and fab flavours.

name: Rachel Bracken
snippet: Beautiful hotel perfect walking distance from everything, staff are friendly but you didn’t seem to be able to reserve a car space and there was also no bath robe in the room which I was about but still 5 stars highly recommended

name: Lorcan Murphy
snippet: Great stay, lovely pristine rooms. Visited the spa for a thermal suit which was a brilliant experience and you can operate in your own time. Nice outdoor jacuzzi aswell. Lovely, genuine staff.

name: Monika Duddy
snippet:
Personally I think this was an ok hotel. We stayed for 2 nights for €400. I really appreciated the extras that were provided for the birthday, a candle, they sang for my fiancé at dinner. It was lovely. The room was nice and clean as well with a nice  river view. The gym was also good. And location is close to the city.

But I found some of the staff either miss communicating or forgetful. We asked for towel and some more tea for our room. They haven’t brought it up for ages so we left for the town. When we got it they gave us lots of coffee sashes instead of tea bags. They didn’t give us new towels every day, or more water I think the hotel may be very understaffed.  Breakfast tasted like a cheap hotel buffet. It made us both feel a bit ill every morning. My fiancé asked for a cappuccino, had to get up to ask for it again. It was brought when he finished his food. The spa facility wasn’t that amazing the one thing that redeems it is the outdoor hot tub, but all of it is also available to the public, so if you come down on a busy day when the public comes you may not even get the chance to use it. And the whole pool and the area felt a bit too cold. I was shivering swimming.

The thermal spa costs extra, we’re told it  closed when we came in even though later we saw someone come out of it.  This did not feel like a 4 star hotel. It’s over priced for the service we got and not to mention also the €9 parking as well per night.

name: Laura Mcdonald
snippet: Beautiful Hotel, spacious comfortable rooms, great food and wonderful polite helpful staff looking forward to my next stay already

name: Catherine McGrane
snippet:
My husband and I stayed at the Hotel last week and treated ourselves to an upgrade on the 5th floor. WOW! what an experience!
We had breakfast both mornings and dinner both evenings. Food was exceptional. Staff are very friendly. Absolutely will come back.

name: Orla Ryan
snippet: Experience was very poor and disappointing. Stayed two nights sea view room and it cost €550 so I our expectations were high. Unfriendly staff. Zero communication amongst staff I.e. such a long wait between drinks and meals, requested robes which took 3 phone calls and a request at reception to get. No house keeping so no fresh towels etc. The reception area looked lovely but I think the service was the biggest let down, we didn’t feel welcome in restaurant, staff seemed very inexperienced. Room service food was disgusting. Unhelpful and unfriendly reception staff except for one man on the first day. Far too many negatives to the positives, the only positives being the stunning spa treatment and the view from the room.

name: Stephen Siu
snippet:
A fantastic family friendly hotel...... But...... That lift system needs looking at. Whilst security is good if you haven't got your key card it can be a bit awkward. Hotel was nice to stay in bed was comfortable shower was good and the room we had , had excellent views.

The swimming pool facility was family friendly and great. There were some kid toys around for them to play with. The pool was not deep about 4.5 feet and there is a small toddler and baby section.

Beer was reasonably priced in the place. Sky sports needs working on very patchy!

This place is really close to the town centre.

name: cora dollard
snippet: Lovely relaxed atmosphere, lots of soft comfortable seating in bar & foyer. We had a problem with our bathroom but were moved to another room immediately. Rooms are spacious, beds very comfortable. Thermal suite is excellent...checkout "the beach " room .

name: Laura Lacey
snippet: Lovely hotel, staff could not be better. Rupert at Reception was exceptional. Breakfast great. Outdoor patio area with large umbrellas, heaters and lovely view. Room spotless. Short walk in to town.

name: Dylan
snippet: Stayed there the night of the retail excellence room was dirty and staff where rude

name: Joakim Brunzell
snippet:
We stayed two nights at the Galmont Spa and Hotel in a family room. The room was nice but a bit cold at start but got better. Really good beds.

The breakfast was a classical one but good. We tried the pool and it was good. However kids below the age of 12 were not allowed to do anything but access the main pool. However there were some treats within the pool that made it a bit special. Bubbles and such.

The location was central but still a bit off. Nice parking spots in the garage for 9 euros a night.

We want to return...

name: Aoife Cassidy
snippet: 5     great location, friendly and helpful staff, tasty meal in warm and comfortable surroundings. Excellent piano player a lovely touch. Also, an upgrade for my 40th birthday.  I can't wait to go back.

name: kay mchugh
snippet: Had spa treatments there this week. My therapist Jade was excellent as was the lady on reception. I've never felt more relaxed. Highly recommend.

name: Kristen Gordon
snippet: Beautiful location. Hotel was spotless. Rooms very well thought out and modern design. Massive massive super king sized bed with soft pillows. Air conditioning. Turn down service was a nice surprise. Location excellent only a few minutes walk from Eyre square and Latin quarter. Hotel staff very knowledgable regarding locale. Well received information! Breakfast delicious and very good selection. Only issue was unsure of breakfast times as was not stated on arrival or in the guestbook. Staff very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Cannot wait to return!

name: Feargus O'Flaherty
snippet: The hotel is nice and a great location. The room was clean, modern and a good size. I am deducting some stars because the kettle in the room was broken and the service in the restaurant was awful. We must have been waiting for at least 30 min for orders to be taken. One starter never arrived so we had to wait some more for that. I ordered the mussels and they were pretty poor, a lot weren't open and most were undercooked. They then got the bill wrong so we had to wait some more for that. Nice hotel, just don't use the restaurant.

name: Stephen Ward
snippet: The hotel is impressive in the lobby but unfortunately that’s were it ends. Food is poor and drinks are over priced. We paid nearly €600 for 2 nights in a balcony room but wouldn’t return. We requested house keeping on the 2nd day of our stay and were told we had to be out of the room for this. We had a saunter around Galway after breakfast as our house keeping was booked for 11am. When we returned at 12 there was no house keeping done. We tried for over 30 minutes to ring reception/house keeping and no one answered. My wife had to ring through an outside line to get someone in reservations. The front of house manager then returned our call and explained that it was because of checkout time and the staff were busy. This is not a reason to not answer phones to guests. What if there was an accident? We were then advised to use the leisure centre whilst house keeping cleaned our room but there was nothing to use as steam room and jacuzzi were out of use because of Covid   The sauna and outdoor tub was open for limited users and the place was packed so we were left standing around. The FOH manager gave us two drink vouchers as an apology for the misunderstanding but when we went to use them we were told there was a €6 limit of each voucher    Plus we were waiting 25 minutes for 2 bottles of beer at 4pm in the afternoon. The Bar was at 20% capacity with one Bar man working but we counted at least 15 floor staff. There is more I could add to this review but it would turn into a novel. Needless to say we would not be returning to the Galmont.

name: Liza Campbell
snippet: Nice bed , good central location. However the breakdown in communication was very bad. Our friends booked this for us as a wedding gift. We had to explain several times that we had merged two separate rooms,  our key cards stopped working on the second day and someone called to our room to tell us check out was 12.30, again we had to explain we had booked two nights. My friend was charged for the prosecco my husband had ordered, and she was also charged for two dessert plates. Not majorly huge complaints but no need for it all the same. When calling reception with questions you had to ring a few times before anyone answered. Also having to pay for parking,  after spending so much  already. Parking in hotels should be free u pay enough for the room.

name: Angela O'Donovan
snippet: We had a really lovely  stay here last weekend! Everything first class , but please remove the supplement payment on the menu, just state the final price, too many  of them!! No need

name: Sandra Barnes
snippet:
Rooms were like new, service in the restaurant and bar was pretty good..we just had a drink in the bar and breakfast 2 mornings.

Walkability: All the shops were easy to get to. I was doing a castle tour, and the Lynch Castle was within walking distance. Loved the vibe here.

name: Conor Cränks
snippet: Nice lobby, nice food, extremely rude manager/ till operator at breakfast on Sunday the 6/02/2022. He really needs a lesson on how to speak to customers! Rest of staff very friendly. Only reason for the reduction in rating was this staff persons manner.

name: Abdullah A
snippet:
I had really bad experience with the clodagh Mc Donald the manager

She was not helpful
I booked 2 kings rooms for 5 days

The room is good and cleaned nice hotel but very bad manger,
in the night someone rings my door for 3 times bothering me!

And they charge me 100 saying I smoked in the room and never smoked in room only electronic cigarettes and I tried to apologise for this and they said ether to pay 100 or sorry we aske you to leave and remaining 1 night for me ! And they took the money from my night + late check out at 3pm !!

Never come back again

name: BL B
snippet: The bed was nice and comfortable and the location was central. However there was a lot of downfalls. As a hotel resident, you have to pay to park your car which is absolutely ridiculous. Certain things in the room were not working and when it was mentioned to the receptionist on checking out, he did not seem bothered and rudely told us that he could not offer us a reduction on the price we payed for the room. This is not what we were suggesting so it was quite insulting. Staff weren’t very welcoming or attentive and huddled in groups in the restaurant chatting and playing with their hair, which is extremely unhygienic especially with the handling of food and drink. We had a drink in the bar and had to witness several people getting thrown out of the hotel which was very disruptive. The barman also refused to make cocktails which were requested and was extremely rude.  I’ve stayed in 3 star, even 2 star hotels and have had a much more enjoyable experience. This hotel to me is by no means a 4 star hotel.

name: Margaret McDonnell
snippet: Love this hotel. It has a lovely local feel  yet the best of international service standards. Excellent business venue for events.

name: Shelly O Connor
snippet: I attended the spa with my two sisters. A treat for one of their birthday's.  I think maybe I was just unfortunate with the therapist I got! As normal the therapist left the room to allow me to get on the bed. I was already wearing a robe, so I was prepared. She did not come  back into the room for 10 minutes.  I asked for firm pressure twice which she didn't do. Her technique was so poor. I was wondering was she actually qualified. When asked if I had enjoyed it, I replied that I did not feel a bit relaxed after it. The young girl on the spa reception was so un professional & rude. I was speechless. I went to reception & spoke with the duty manager & allayed my disappointment the way we were spoken to by the reception. She was very understanding. I received a call from the manager of the spa apologising for her staffs poor behaviour.. I was offered a treatment for the following day which I declined. I will write a very positive review on the rest of our hotel experience  as the room, food, resturant staff, reception staff  & house keeping were so pleasant &

name: darren cross
snippet: spent 2 nights a Galmont on arrival we spent 25 min just trying to get into car park as there was a function going on in hotel went to reception and it was very loud fair enough it was an occasion going on our room was small as it was a superior room it was a small bit grubby marks on walls and bathroom ceiling was very dirty. the room had a safe which did not work it had a fridge that was great, the view was poor we had a skip outside the window and woke us up being changed at 8.15 next morning ,the bed was big and comfortable. The staff are friendly and location is good not to far to city centre.Breakfast is super lots of choice and nice food over all we had a nice stay if it was same room I would not return ...

name: Bláthnaid Kearney
snippet:
The hotel itself is beautiful, in a lovely location, my issue was with the restaurant.
I was there for a hen a few weeks ago, and am vegan. I know the organiser of the hen emailed back and forth explaining there would be a vegan well in advance, as we were prepaying dinner with our stay in the hotel. I also rang and told reception I would be there etc and would there be a vegan option available. The guy on the phone was lovely and assured me they had vegans stay all the time and there would of course be options for me.
At the dinner, no vegan options were offered and the lovely lady serving us seemed surprised by my request. She brought me out a small bowl of green leaves, 2 Slices of tomato and some raw shaved onion as my starter. I told her I was disappointed with this and she said she could get me a different dressing. Same story with the main, they said the burger could be done vegan but it came out with mayonnaise on it, which I scraped off. My dessert was one of the fruit pots they serve at breakfast. I was so disappointed. The galmount has such a great reputation and is very pricey, but the food was such a letdown. I mentioned it again at check out and although the woman was lovely there was no real apology made and looking back I wish I had asked for a partial refund for the meal because it really was awful. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone with any kind of dietary requirements.

name: Shannon Ireland
snippet: Just an OK hotel. A bit run down BUT rooms are clean. Did try to close the window and the handle easily came off (staff seemed unphased by it). Did misplace my luggage but quickly found it. Food was standard. Service was slow and forgetful and rarely checked on your table and in some cases were hard to find.

name: Dermot O'Sullivan
snippet:
The hotel is lovely. The spa is really nice, and the outdoor hot tub is great.
We were on a package that included dinner, but the restaurant was closed, so we were in the extended bar area. The food was nice, but the service was poor enough, it took almost 20 mins to figure out what menu we should use and the attention was sparse. Granted it was a Sunday, but just a bit disappointing, especially considering how nice the hotel is.
I would recommend the hotel, but perhaps eat elsewhere, there are many very nice restaurants in the city.

name: Rita DeFilippis
snippet: Very nice hotel, the food is good.  Staff was exceptionally accomidating.  Walking distance to train station and town.

name: Adrian Corey
snippet: We were upgraded to a top floor suite as we were celebrating a special birthday. The accommodation was wonderful with panoramic views of the lake. The food was delicious however the service was terrible, we started our meal at 7pm and by 10pm we were ordering our desserts. Now in fairness there was a major function going on and the restaurant was full, so the staff were rushed off their feet, so really it was poor management/organisation. Now having said all the above I would still happily visit again.

name: Dana Ayn Gregorio
snippet: We had a very comfortable and pleasant stay. The receptionist was very professional and helpful. He checked us in soon as we arrived eventhough it was still early as we were coming from a long journey. We also booked a dinner in their restaurant and I have requested a celebratory dessert last minute. However, staff named Jacinta made it possible to still get it for us. She was very polite and welcoming. Overall our stay was fabulous, hotel was very keen with the covid restrictions, hand sanitizers available and social distance markings. The hotel is maintained with cleanliness, spotless and staff are very friendly. Definitely recommend!

name: S T
snippet: Very quick check in, Evan was very efficient, friendly and professional. Room 154 clean & tidy. Breakfast room is very spacious, breakfast isn't of high quality. Ben looked after us for our tea & toast. Good man! I'm not a huge fan of hotel food, again the Galmont is no different. Everything is on the lower scale of quality. Scrambled eggs made in the microwave just destroys the flavour. Pre made pancakes & low quality bacon. We need people to actively challenge hotels on the quality of food as we pay a high price for a stay, the least we expect is a high quality breakfast. Come on Galmont, no more scrambled eggs in the microwave & increase the quality of the produce. Chefs serving breakfast were a great laugh.

name: Aisling Mulligan
snippet: Huge room, huge bed, great gym and spa facilities and the breakfast is great! Very quiet at night and comfy bed. I would like to see the bathroom a bit more modern, with a walk in shower however the towels were so soft and loved their initials.

name: Marian Quinn
snippet:
My daughter and I stayed overnight and it was a fantastic experience.  The staff were so helpful and nice. We booked into our room at 1pm and we were allowed to keep the car in the carpark next day till 9pm even though we had booked out. The hotel is conveniently placed for shopping in galway city.
A fantastic experience and we will return.

name: John Blanchard
snippet: The service here was killer. I stopped in a sunday morning after a sesh. The food was on point. The atmosphere was nice and there were plenty of staff to cater the many customers. I would stop in for breakfast any chance you get. Only complaint: Tables were a bit crowded for getting to and from the self serve breakfast counter without bumping into other tables, but didn't take away from the expirence.

name: Jack O'Loughlin
snippet: A very big but lovely hotel. Superb staff. Rare atmosphere and piano bar til late. We'd come back.

name: Mark Egan
snippet:
Pretty good stay at the Galmont, rooms are great, hotel modern and looks well. 5 min walk into the city, nice breakfast.

Cons:
* Have to pay for parking and get your ticket validated every time you come and go(being able to scan your room key would be better)

* Dinner in the main restaurant was just ok for the price, give it a miss and vist the great places in Galway city.

* Room is not servied during your stay so have to request if need clean towls, sheets, water ect..

* Pool was busy both times we went, booking is in place for covid but seems like there is too many people per session.

name: kelly ryan
snippet:
I was very very disappointed with our stay. 380 euro for 2 nights for 2 of us. Our room was not cleaned for our second night. This hotel claims its 4 star its not. We ate in the restaurant where I was served a caesar salad that was missing croutons, parmensan cheese and dressing so i got served bacon, chicken and lettuce my partner ordered a burger that was just a bun and burger it was missing all dressings. Service was very bad we would be waiting ages before any staff came near us for a drink or when we ordered they would forget. 12.50 for a cocktail that tasted like ice our table and two other tables sent there's back. They had a cocktail menu but were missing most of them Our room was had one window and when i opened the curtain we were looking down at reception so we could hear all in our room and couldnt open window to let fresh air in. Upon checking out after paying 380 we were charged 9 euro a night for parking. Very disappointing stay for that price. You are paying for location thats it.

Sent

name: Bridget Carr
snippet: Cold rooms. Dont accept rooms 1395 and the other 2 nearby.  No proper heating provided.  Failte Ireland now investigating all rooms.  Bring extra quilts and hot water bottles if you want to stay at the galmont

name: Eric Hendrix
snippet: Very nice hotel, staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean, and our King sized bed was the most comfortable that we had in Ireland. NOTE- STAY AWAY FROM MARINA'S RESTAURANT (see my review under the restaurant).

name: mayryanna Shakti
snippet: Clean, comfortable accomodations near the center of Galway. The breakfast is plentiful and delicious as well! Friendly, attentive staff and thoughtful details have made it a wonderful stay. We highly recommend!

name: Gerard Brangan
snippet: Just a one night stay this time, for an early Saturday morning business appointment  : very pleased with the service ( really enjoyed the pianist who played while we ate our meal). Will definitely return.

name: Elaine Finnegan
snippet: Really great stay here, location was perfect. Breakfast, it seemed they were understaffed, was difficult to get a coffee etc, but staff were friendly and apologetic. Dinner (Sunday 29th Dec) in the restaurant, we couldn't fault it. The younger waiter was terrific, coming from a hospitality background I was very impressed. Will definitely recommend!

name: Josephine Moynihan
snippet: Fabulous hotel and staff were very friendly & helpful.  Great location.  Quiet location at night but still very close to City Centre. Would highly recommend and will definitely go back.

name: Mary Darcy
snippet: Lovely hotel, fantastic location, but the hotel was just not ready for people, not enough staff, 10 to 15 mins waiting on drinks, first drink was actually nearly a half hour!! We were not prompted on check in to book pool times and dinners, I had rang previously about booking terrace and was told they don't take bookings it's first come first served.... silly me thought that meant same for barfood....that was not the case and then there were very limited options.... Once booked we the turned up to find out the booking had not gone through. The bar menu was very limited, I believe there were 4 pasta dishes on menu, fish and chips and burger and chips, no vegetables came with the pasta I dish ordered. It was pleasant food but disappointing overall....

name: Dave Barrett
snippet: As our bedroom wasn’t ready until after 5pm, our Christmas one night break didn’t get off the the best start. It was only made worse when we arrived to the room which was sub zero temperature.... probably hadn’t been used for a while. To be fair, they did change the room when I highlighted the issue. The following morning the Q for breakfast was about 40 minutes ....I couldn’t believe the amount of free tables In the restaurant when we eventually made it to the top of the Q. The hotel quite simply didn’t have enough staff to clear quick enough. All in, the staff were overworked and very polite while the hotel were evidently trying to save money at every chance. A real shame as a great hotel of old.

name: Donal Moylan
snippet: Over all very over priced 9euro a night for parking ,breakfast is basic and cold. I am currently staying here and check out in the morning so don't think I be coming back. There are plenty of nicer hotel's in Galway.

name: Diana K
snippet: Booked in a few days ago in one of the executive suites so payed a good bit of money … we were not happy with the overall all experience. On the last night I couldn’t wait to go back home and we would usually never ever be like that , normally we would be freaked that we have to leave but this was the first time something was completely off. When checking in we didn’t receive a welcoming smiling atmosphere all we got is oh is it your first time ok welcome so your booked in for 3 nights breakfast and dinner that way and that’s about it … we’re as usually for a 4 star hotel they would make you feel welcomed and comfortable, have a nice chat with you tell you what room your in etc. Got none of that . Dinner/breakfast service must say was very poor … waited a long time and when asking for a simple thing like could we get still water instead of sparkling we waited about 20 minutes and then we didn’t get any glasses to pour the water into . I got a dessert after my dinner the first night and it never came I waited like 40 minutes till my boyfriend had to pull one of the waitresses and tell them and then I got it 5 minutes later. Breakfast was no different, food was very average but food wasn’t as nice as any other place we have been too and we couldn’t put a finger on it as to why that is… service we got for first day was poor again asking have we been to breakfast before and we said no and all that was told to Us was ok buffet over there and continental food over there enjoy… never told about no pancakes or poached eggs etc. Like one of the couples got on the third day before we were checking out .very very poor. On the second day when we got a table given to us and when we came back with our food it was given to someone else and bless the pair that were sitting there they were going to give it to us as they probably knew it was for us but we just found another one as it wasn’t there fault what so ever . Room service menu also not given in the room as we tried getting it and they told us there is a special menu for it but we did not have this so when we did order the food they rang us back to tell us one thing can’t be gotten which was disappointing… no lights out on the balcony and all the ones next to us had lights turned on besides ours and we checked every switch to make sure we didn’t miss it but there was none for outside . I could go on but overall very poor and unpleasant experience, would definitely not recommend it to anyone far more friendlier ,nicer and cheaper 4 stars out there .

name: Darina Doyle
snippet: The bed is lovely and the room is very spacious but the bathroom is kind of odd. Everything is in an odd place. The hand soap is too low, the toilet paper hidden by the hand towel, and the toilet didn't have a lid.

name: stephen moss
snippet:
The hotel is amazing room's fantastic and the spar is out of this world
It does have a problem with congestion at the lifts as you can be left waiting for quite some time to go up or down especially if you're trying to access the car park. it does have stairs but they're very hard to find
The breakfast is first class with everything you could want or need.
But the evening menu is a bit limited and maybe because it was so busy not quite at the high standard that I'd come to expect nothing wrong so to say, presentation really nice it had a good flavour but just wasn't anything special certainly didn't leave me wanting to go back which is a pity
as I say maybe because it was busy but that's the only reason it's a 4 not a 5

name: Joan Scales
snippet: The Galmont is a lovely hotel and a great location in Galway. It has everything you need for a city break. The Christmas decorations are lovely. The bus and train station are minutes away.

name: rachel mcmahon
snippet: Lovely hotel great location, very friendly staff. We received a complementary upgrade on our room which was a lovely surprise. Spa staff and leisure club staff also lovely. Will definitely go back and would highly recommend the hotel. All Covid guidelines followed

name: D F
snippet:
Service Poor
Staff Unfriendly
Takes hrs to get food
Don’t go by the lovely photos on the website.
It’s basically a 2 star located in the middle of a car park. On the plus side you don’t need an alarm call as the trains will wake you up from about 5.30 am onwards and for that privilege you can pay a extra charge for a sea view room which has no views of the sea but lovely views of the trains and all the magnificent graffiti that comes along with it.

name: Reggie Perrin
snippet: Room clean & comfortable staff helpful & friendly. Bar menu as you would expect burgers, fish & chips etc but was very nice.
