Only let down for me the chaotic buffet breakfast - I had my cooked breakfast almost eaten by time tea & toast arrived. Didn't bother second morning plenty of options in Galway with its café culture. Hotel was centrally located to visit Galway without having to get back in the car. Will stay here again. Underground car park but limited space so check in early or park in coach station car park opposite.

name: Sean O'H.
snippet: Fantastic hotel with all the amenities! In addition to the awesome free breakfast and huge room, we had a great dinner at the hotel. We also took advantage and f the fitness room and hot tubs. Just a quick walk from the main drag within Galway. Highly recommend the Galmont Hotel & Spa!

name: David Schroeder
snippet:
Rooms could be a little better, and the shower pressure could be a lot better. I felt like I was being pee on
The breakfast was nice, though made up for the bad shower

name: Sandra Lyons
snippet: My husband, our 2 year old son and I visited the Galmont today for Sunday brunch and found it to be really excellent. The manager and staff were so helpful and professional. The food was really fresh and tasty and there was the perfect selection of starters, mains and desserts with a glass of prosseco to start. The restaurant was so relaxing with gorgeous views of Lough Atalia. There was a kids playroom just off the dining room with plenty to keep the little ones occupied and we weren't charged for our sons food which was a lovely touch. Will definitely visit again!

name: Catherine Cantwell
snippet:
Lovely room. Food excellent. Only complaint. Not enough staff those that were there were brilliant run off their feet. Terrace littered on Saturday night. Sanitisers empty. Loved REAL hangers.
Would stay again at less busy timr

name: Ciara McEvoy
snippet: Nice hotel, reception experience was great. We had hit and miss service with some of the staff in Cooper's bar. The superior rooms were definitely worth upgrading to. We had no view but great space. The hotel itself has a lot to offer. Spa and leisure centre, jacuzzi etc. 5 minute walk from Eyre square. Very central, nice Galway hotel.

name: Guenther Moeller
snippet: Absolutely terrific hotel!  Friendly staff; a quiet room; a soft bed for a great night sleep after a day of touring Galway.  The hotel is very close to shopping and pubs.  But Cooper's pub in the hotel also pours a great Guinness!  You can't go wrong stating here.  Coming from overseas, I was very happy with my stay.

name: Anyaz GH
snippet: We booked a superior king room on the Booking website, for one night. We chose this place because it was the only one that was available "cheap" with supposedly breakfast included, I really do not know if we get confused but we are sure that the room we had booked included breakfast, then I started researching again on booking and The subject of breakfast is certainly random, constantly changing and tending to confusion. I caused disappointment but I gave a vote of confidence to the room, when we arrived the views were oriented to a warehouse roof, I mean that fantastic, we started well. I started to get cold in the afternoon, and the heating did not work, it was completely off or not working, instead I had a ridiculous little oil heater that could barely heat the room, that is not typical of a 4 star hotel, I spent 204 € for a night in which I sincerely thought it was expensive for what I was offered. The plus point, the bed was very comfortable and the cleanliness excellent but everything else did not make me feel satisfied enough.

name: Dan Wilsford
snippet: Rooms were clean and there were plenty of things to do within walking distance. Great little bar to set it at the end of the night.

name: heavo g
snippet: Terrible,  completely overpriced for what is offered, party of 15 anyone drinking a tap drink guinness heineken etc was terrible, then there was the restaurant food was terrible apart from the chowder which was actually nice but thats about it, the service was terrible could barely even get water to the table during the meal never mind a top up of wine or any other drink not the waiters problem completely understaffed considering there was 3 big tables and multiple smaller tables which were all given bad service. A beautiful hotel but very disappointed in the food and drink side of things and service which is a staffing problem and no reflection on the staff that is currently there as they are doing the best they can.

name: Anne Reilly
snippet: Excellent All Round! We were lucky enough to get a balcony room on 5th floor!! So spacious!! The massive bed was so comfy. What a view outside. Already knew of its Super location as we stayed here before and will again. Loved the swim facilities, Esp the hot tub.

name: Leah Carroll
snippet:
The MHL Hotel Collection have a good portfolio of hotels but there are a number of issues that need to be addressed before they become bigger problems. I’ve a feeling that profit over guest experience is the main goal. Long term restructuring would better achieve a more fulfilling stay for their guests as well as a profitable and well run hotel chain.

Parking in Galway is at a premium so you have to pay €9 a day to park in the Galmont Hotel underground car park which is badly laid out, the spaces are limited & very tight.

Making the initial booking directly with the Galmont for two rooms over the phone ended up confusing & the request was mixed up. The confirmation email only contained a booking for one room and we had to contact the Galmont again.

On the confirmation email you have to click a link to book dinner and breakfast. Neither of those bookings came through with a confirmation.

When checking in, we had to ask for the second room on the booking, which initially was a surprise to the staff and then they found it.

When checking in to one of the rooms, luckily the guests next door let us know that they were late night drinking buddies as they had left a huge tray of empty Guinness pint glasses, a bottle of wine and gin & tonic glasses outside their room.

The staff on the main desk were extremely helpful when I asked to switch rooms and explained why. As I was returning to the old room to pick up my bags, one of the porters was already swiftly removing the empty drinks tray. Godspeed new neighbours.

Had two nice pints of Guinness at the bar.
Crispy chicken wings were delicious for starters in the main restaurant. The meat in the burger was also very good. Eton Mess for dessert has very little cream (if you like it with lots of cream).

Breakfast has a selection of fruit in a dish (wrapped in cellophane), yoghurt pots, cereals & hot breakfast. You ask the chef for specific items, scrambled eggs or fried eggs, sausages, rashers etc and he puts them on a plate for you.

The toast, croissant and small danish basket, weren’t fresh.

The towels need softener, they’re good for exfoliating but are at the end of their use and need to be replaced.

The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is clean. The cleaners didn’t hover under a moveable piece of furniture, when I pushed it aside I found wrappers underneath.

The lift software needs updating. Both lifts  go to a floor when called, instead of recognising that the other lift has already picked up the initial caller.

Experiences I’ve had in other MHL Hotel Collection are similar in that they are charging a premium rate, in once premium hotel locations but for a less than premium experience from this group.

name: Barry Fitzpatrick
snippet: Absolutely excellent hotel.  Was there for a wedding weekend and it could not be better.  Superb service and staff.  Food was excellent.  Room spacious and comfortable.  Fabulous breakfast.  Such choice. Will be back

name: Brittney Carter
snippet: Trust the bad reviews! One sheet on bed. Two twin beds pushed together for a king. Chipped paint on all the walls. Unorganized staff in the front lobby. Old bathrooms. If you book earlier for your stay in Galway you can find way better value for your money. I don’t recommend this hotel. Equivalent to a Super 8 in the States.

name: G. V. Q
snippet:
The bathroom in the room smelled bad, the sea view that we paid for overlooked the car park entrance and showed a tiny snippet of Lough Attalia....not a sea view.
The bar had a TV on with the sound muted, then music on that cut in and out constantly. Very unpleasant combo. Also, my partner forgot her phone charger in the room, the hotel say that it wasn't there..... So the cleaners took it. Our fault, but still, poor show..

name: Kelly Hendel
snippet: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in late August 2019. In our opinion,  everything about it is average. The line to be seated for breakfast was ridiculously long the first two mornings we were there. Clearly they needed an additional staff member to seat people. On the last morning there we left so early that we ended up paying for full Irish breakfast, but walked out with an apple, banana and cup of tea because that's all they had to offer. I was NOT happy about that. Ordered room service the second night, just a pizza, and after an hour I had to call again to find out what was going on. They said it would be right up. Thirty minutes later it arrived. We informed the front desk and they removed the delivery charge from our bill. The pizza itself was nothing special and the night before when we ate in the restaurant the food was unremarkable and the service,  although friendly,  was slow even though they were not busy. The pool was slimy. We were both slipping at the edges by the steps. Pictures posted make it look like hotel is right on the water, but in fact there is a busy road in between. It is conveniently located near the train and bus station and not a far walk from everything worth seeing and doing in Galway.  If we had to do it all over again,  we would not stay here.

name: Gemma MhicGhráinne
snippet: Great hotel .Central, clean and modern. Swimming pool, sauna and steam room great. Showers and changing room very clean. Also available is Spa and full massage and facial treatments on offer. Prices for pampering about average. Full Irish breakfast available. Tea coffee in room. Overnight parking 9 euro per night.

name: L Knight 7
snippet: Great hotel in Galway city. The rooms  are nice and comfortable. Spa and gym with pool sauna.. Great position 150m to Eyre Square

name: Tommy Duffy
snippet: This Hotel is ideally located for any visitor to Galway. Lovely spacious clean rooms, great breakfast and some perfect relaxation areas. We enjoyed our annual mini family break with our 3 adult children. I recommend you book a sea view room as it's a fine Vista the greet your morning.

name: Beth Brennan
snippet: This is a fabulous hotel, really well located, we travelled there by train and it was just around the corner, main square, shopping, restaurants and some tourist attractions all within walking distance. The rooms are lovely & the bedding very comfy. Food in restaurant was gorgeous. I'm a coeliac & anything that came from the kitchen was fabulous, the gf toaster at breakfast buffet was being used by people for normal bread which is only issue we had throughout our stay.. Definitely recommend it.

name: Graham Hammond
snippet:
We booked the Galmont hotel for me and my Fiancè. On entry to the hotel we were flabbergasted to see the beauty and cleanliness of the hotel. We were welcomed by the receptionist very politely and professionally. On arrival to the room we were pleased to see that it was quite spacious and warm. The bathroom was very clean and tidy and the bedroom was without fault. Beautiful beds and lighting. The swimming pool was excellent but the temperature of the pool was quite cold. We used to Jacuzzi instead because the water was very cold. The quality of the Jacuzzi was not great and the ten minute timer had us cold again. The advertised hot tub we seen during booking was out of order when we arrived and no water in it at all. The bar food was not to the standard we payed for, very overpriced for mediocre food. The restaurant and sushi bar was closed also during our stay so we didn't even get to enjoy a fancy meal in the hotel. The service in the bar was very poor. We had to wait over half an hour after we finished our food to get the bill and have our dishes taken off us despite asking numerous times. Although it was not busy.The pillows and blankets in the room were not very comfortable and had a plastic feel. The pillows would not fluff and just sank when we lay on them. Very uncomfortable. Woke up with a sore back.

Overall we enjoyed our stay, aside from the poor comments above it would have been 5 stars. We still enjoyed our stay at The Galmont Hotel and would come back again.

name: Edel Lynch
snippet:
We spent Saturday here for the Canonball, it was a great few hours for kiddies, especially if they are into cars.

The hotel itself is lovely. Most of staff were friendly.

name: Rory Fagan
snippet:
Good hotel ,good staff and service ,nice pool and food and rooms were  very nice.
Needed more on reception, and 2 lifts in a hotel that size was a planning oversight.
Seen many guests waiting  for periods of time.

name: Ben Grossman
snippet: Lovely hotel.  Great rooms. Very slow service with drinks and room service.  Unable to get in touch with reception/ room service/ anyone at all. Would expect better service for 410e per night

name: Mary Rose O'Mahony
snippet: Lovely rooms Reception desk undermanned waited 15 minutes and left Breakfast OK Orange juice not fresh as expected Glass chipped Plate had egg stain on it from previous use On the otherhand rooms pristine and location great Think parking should be included in room rate

name: Brian Burke
snippet: I can't understand how this is a 4 star hotel. The service is appalling. The room was fine, except the iron was broken.  It took 5 calls to reception to get a replacement. My partner was hit on the head by a chair being carried by a staff member in the bar and when it was pointed out to him he didn't even apologise. The queue for breakfast was 25 mins despite numerous tables in the restaurant being empty but with dirty dishes on them. No staff were clearing tables. Friends who were also staying in the hotel ordered breakfast to their room. One breakfast was delivered instead of two. Checking out took an eternity with long queues. All in all, the facilities in the hotel are ok, but the staff and management are entirely incompetent. Avoid.

name: Andrew Manning
snippet: After paying nearly €390 for 1 nights stay and being told we would have sea view, only to be told on arrival sea view was no longer available was disappointing. Also asked for champagne to be in the room when booking but was told due to Covid it wasn’t Possible.. Then to see a Blogger showing his room with the Sea view and alcohol in his room but this wasn’t possible for me? Disappointing.

name: PATRICK WALSH
snippet: Location is great as its within walking distance from Eyre Square and city centre. Reasonably priced and decent breakfast, rooms leave a little to be desired and could do with tidying up a few things although they are clean. Staff are very friendly and helpful, food is decent but lots of places close by.

name: Kerry Mink
snippet: Stayed at The Galmont for 4 nights on business trip. The hotel room was very clean and had a wonderful view of the Atlantic sea. The bed and pillows and duvet were a pleasure to fall into each night. Breakfast was fabulous especially like the bacon which was not the usual overcooked at other hotels. Very tasty. Staff were a pleasure in the bar even when hotel was busy. I have stayed before and brought 4 company colleagues with me thus time. I will be back. Thanks to all at The Galmont for making our stay relaxed and enjoyable!

name: Tim O'Leary
snippet: We spent a night here on our way home from Donegal, it was a very pleasant evening with really good food and wine and very helpful staff. The room was very comfortable and breakfast was spot on. Well worth a visit

name: Claire L
snippet: Went for lunch and to use the thermal suite. Lovely experience...only had soup and salad but both were delish and the brown bread was   . Lovely thermal suites and relaxation room and also availed of the our door hot tub. We were there during the day and almost had the place to ourself but I could imagine it gets busy in the evening and weekend. Will definitely return

name: Rachel OMalley
snippet: Beautiful hotel. Room was small but had everything we needed. Bar, reception area was beautiful. I would recommend this hotel for it's central location, short walk from Eyre square

name: Kurt Haserodt
snippet: Spent two weeks there on business.  Standard king room was cozy, well appointed, and quite comfortable.  Working space was quite good, and power outlets abounded both there and throughout the room.  WiFi and Internet connection was sufficiently speedy for multiple devices at the same time.  Breakfasts were divine, and often served as only meal required.  It was quite easy walking distance to all the sights and fun places the city had to offer.  In August there were several tour buses full of one night stays (with suitcases in the hall by 7:00), but they were handled well, and I didn't notice a decrease in service quality.

name: Connor O'Flanagan
snippet:
It's my second stay here. Great spot, attentive staff and the food is great. My advice is if you're coming here for the spa then make sure you book your in advance. I wanted to book in for a massage but both times there was no availability.
Great spot in one of (if not the) best city's in ireland

name: Jane Leonard
snippet:
Plenty of parking. Nice lively hotel bar. Rooms are modern and too bottled of water provided each day.
The hotel is larger than you would think and our room was quite a distance from reception.

name: Sebastian Thejus Cherian
snippet: Was billed for a family room with lake-view but we got a double room facing another wing. When we requested another room, we were asked to pay extra. They heeded to our request only after we asked to checkout.

name: Ita Connolly
snippet: Situated in the heart of Galway a modern hotel with excellent helpful,cheerful staff ! Rooms are modern but bathrooms need updating. Overall a great place.

name: Laura Redmond
snippet: Not impressed.  The front facade of institutional yellow brick looks nothing like what we saw online. Bathrooms were old and poor.  There are nicer hotels right downtown.  Otherwise, the common lounge was nice, food was good & service was great.  And Galway is spectacular.

name: Christopher Moore
snippet: I want to be fair here - hotel was mostly amazing. Pretty good location (although it’s a bit of a dodgy neighborhood, it is close to High Street, Eyre Square, and the waterfront. Food and accommodation were very good. However, I was leading a group of people and two suitcases were damaged by the porters. Things happen, I know, but to have to bags badly damaged shows real disregard on the part of staff for others’ personal property. Otherwise had an enjoyable stay. Particularly liked the hotel bar where there was a lively atmosphere for the Champions League Final.

name: Eliz Zaimova
snippet: Really disappointed with the room service experience. The guy that brings the food is really nice and I’m super happy with the service. I got my lunch order with wrong side and didn’t get my dinner at all- from the fish and chips I ordered I got only the cold chips. They missed the dessert too. The reception is really rushing on the phone when getting orders. Sorry guys used to love the overall experience here.

name: Kenneth Ritenour
snippet: Nice and helpful staff. Great breakfast. Very comfortable room with good beds.

name: Michele Packard-Milam, CAE
snippet: I have stayed at the Galmont (formerly the Radisson Blu) three times in the past four years, and it it is consistently clean, comfortable and has a friendly staff. The food is good (not great) and the bar is a bit slow in service, but it’s a great business hotel. The breakfast buffet is huge and quite good, but the catered food we had for our meeting dinner event was just okay. The terrace is a lovely place to enjoy the sea air and sunset over a Guinness.

name: Shel Quinn
snippet: Really lovely hotel. Our room was really nice . Staff lovely too. Great views from our room. Only fault was after paying €180 for our room parking was €9per day but we would stay again.

name: Derek Sutcliffe
snippet: It's a super nice place that has a really good pool and is walking distance to a lot of cool stuff

name: Tom McManus
snippet:
Very good hotel.  Clean, good atmosphere.  Staff friendly and helpful. Food very good.
Drank in hotel lounge during our stay,  but the bar service was very slow.

name: Alison Heeney
snippet: Location great, beds so comfy, spa very professional, reception staff very unhelpful with my booking and five bar staff behind bar and not one acknowledged us standing right in front of them, breakfast a bit hit and miss, good variety but sausages and bacon very undercooked

name: Tom deans
snippet: Great hotel, spent 3 days. Good breakfast, really nice staff, nice room. Only comment  is it's a conference center and they had big groups, can't really falt them for doing good business though.

name: Isabella Morris
snippet: Absolutely amazing, beautiful hotel. Staff were amazing. Breakfast buffet was out of this world. Would recommend everyone to stay here when visiting Galway..

name: Jeremy Green
snippet: Just a warning for American travelers used to AC. Some rooms do not come with AC. The lowered rating is due reporting a broken phone in the room and requesting an extra fan to help cool the room and after being told they'd take care of it nothing happened. Overall a decent hotel and a great breakfast.

name: Sarah K
snippet: Favorite hotel of our trip. Modern, clean, A/C, great views, and good location. Easy walking distance to pedestrianized city centre but tucked away in a corner so it stays quiet in front and behind the hotel. Nice bar deck out back looking over the bay.

name: Mitzi McGilvray
snippet: Beautiful hotel just a short walk to Galway City Centre. The family room was ample in size and quite comfortable. The breakfast was extremely good with many nice selections.

name: Stephanie Wheaton
snippet: The rooms are a good size, but there are no USB ports for charging devices? The staff is wonderful, it's a little bit of a walk to get to the best parts of the city.

name: Kasia M
snippet: Had  work event on pre-booked weeks in advance. Two vegan meals were arranged with the hotel. When arrived at the party no vegan food seemed to be out so after approaching one of the staff members we finally got some food after half an hour waiting. Could not believe what we got at a pre-booked party in such a beautiful and high standard hotel. For dessert we got chocolate mousse with sorbet which was nice despite the fact that again we had to ask member of staff for vegan desserts.

name: Elaine Murtagh
snippet: Had a really lovely stay here, the room was perfect, comfortable bed, the mini bar was great too. Staff were friendly and helpful. The outdoor Jacuzzi was so refreshing. Would definitely stay again.

name: Anne McMahon
snippet:
Lovely Staff , helpful and friendly .
It was clean and perfect for city centre,  didn't hear one seagull in the morning.
Food was okay , limited options for vegetarians on the dinner menu . No recycling bins in the roomsor lobby areas just rubbish bins .

name: Esther G
snippet: The staff were very helpful and welcoming. We stayed here on two occasions. I recommend a room with a water view! In the room they offer a selection of teas and instant coffee. There are wine glasses provided in the room and bottle opener. Great dining options and room service in the hotel, but the location of this hotel is within walking distance to the city center, tons of yummy dining options, and shop street. It is also right across the street from the bus station, so if you're traveling without a car this hotel is in the best location you could ask for!

name: Ger Kelly
snippet: John at receiption excellent! Very professional attentive n welcoming. Room 320 lovely. Spotless!! When we asked for more solid pillows we got them in mins. Breakfast was just amazing. Food excellent. Waitresses were very helpful n prompt in service. We'll be back. Ger

name: Kerry Mink
snippet: Stayed at The Galmont again March 29. As ever the hotel was fabulous. Beds and linen are soo so comfortable. Service was impeccable. Congratulations to the Galmont team

name: Eugene McDermott
snippet: One of the best hotels in Galway.. Brilliant location (particularly if travelling by train) The staff can't do enough for you.. Presley on reception deserves a special mention for being so professional... But in a very natural and warm way.. Would highly recommend staying here

name: Peter Coughlan
snippet: Not impressed we booked via the phone to rule out any issues the girl told us we would have a family room with at least two beds.. her words were "your son won't even know your watching tv". We arrived to a room with one bed contacted reception by means of walking down as they didn't answer the phone...to be told we don't have any other rooms. They said we can fit in an extra bed with no other option that is what we had to do.  Park that aside and head to the bar area pick a seat in the lobby wait 10 minutes no one comes near,  eventually walk up and look for service and it continues like that not one waitress or waiter will come back unless your right on their regular path even then you need to get your shout in which to me seams rude. Having stayed here while it was the raddison its gone down hill big time. Watch here I won't get a reply they don't care!!!

name: Leah West
snippet: Excellent stay as always. We stay every year at Xmas. Its Pure luxury and relaxation. The only thing I was disappointed by was the wait at the bar for drinks and the cocktails were very poor unlike other years.

name: Davina
snippet: The service really let the hotel down.... it was shocking!!

name: Ruth Stephenson
snippet: Nice hotel. Comedy gig well catered for. Tables provided for drinks and not overcrowded. However all ladies toilets were blocked that evening!

name: Darren Kearns
snippet: Spotless clean hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful. One of the cleanest places I've visited also. Lovely views of the lough from the outside seating area too.

name: Margaret Spain
snippet: Had a lovely stay in the Galmont . Friendly staff and room clean and adequate. Great breakfast . Will stay again

name: Bin Mailbox
snippet:
Me and my friend stayed one night. Hotel is renovated (at least some areas) and it turns out that it really is needed. We booked twin and access as there wasn't much to choose from booking last minute so we have picked two different rooms to see what would be the difference (I don't mind access rooms as I wasn't expecting it too be just way behind other 4* hotels standards). Selecting our hotel was based on location for this trip - which is perfect in fact. 5 minutes walk from the train station and located basically close to major places in town.
There wasn't anything outstanding about service we've received, however Brendan at the check-out was very customer service oriented - Thank You.

It seem to me it was one of the oldest and most "tired" floor / room / maybe whole hotel I've seen. Rooms are far from being enjoyable. White bulbs for daylight, yellow bulbs for reading (side lamp). Very few TV channels some with breaking image. No radio channels, no music channels no HDMI ports. Mirror placed too high to see yourself while sitting beside the desk - you would face bottom of mirror frame. Shower curtains too short - flooding whole bathroom after one shower (access rm). Towels gets wet too easily as they are too close and too low, no other place to put them. There was clothes retractable string dryer but too close to curtain and not usable for towels. Furniture old, noisy and very tired. Minibar was empty...sadly. Available toiletry was basically same products under different label (for example shampoo and shower gel).

Breakfast was served in to our room - hot and Fresh! Thank you.

On the desk, there was a letter explaining...renovation process - too much about the hotel and nothing about their guests. Hotel seem to proud of themselves but in fact there isn't much they could be proud about apart of one only thing that surprised me.
It's difficult to remember all places you would sleep in but I think they do have most amazing mattresses I was ever sleeping on.

While most traveling customers would agree that comfortable and enjoyable sleep is every hotel most important task, taking shortcuts with everything else wouldn't make me personally come back and recommend it - photography is main reason for my journeys and HDMI connectivity is as important to me as anything else most four star hotels does offer but not this one. I was not pleased reading that letter after seeing how poor my room was.

name: Deirdre Flanagan
snippet:
Went here for the spa, we were shown where to go but given no information on any of the different facilities. I did notice if you're having a treatment you get a tour and all the information you need.

Food & drinks: Friendly staff  but fairly slow service, probably understaffed. The food was good.

name: Loredana Paiu
snippet: Very nice hotel,we was for 2 night the breakfast was all right,we was at swimming pool but cold water,jacuzzy no working same as outdoor pool  staff are not so okay,service cleaning same  and price very expencive

name: eileen mcsweeney
snippet: Weak shower. Room wasn't cleaned until we asked... stayed 3 nights. Parking 9 euros per day. Not good value for money.will not return here . Only plus is  nice pool breakfast & staff

name: A Basu
snippet: Best place to stay in Galway. My room had a direct view across the lake. I used to wake up every morning and stare at the lake watching the sun rise slowly over it from my window. The hotel restaurant served great lamb shanks. Location is just 2 min from bus and train station

name: Declan Mills
snippet: Great hotel and Central beside train station and buses

name: m lawlor
snippet: Excellent Hotel in perfect central location with safe underground parking. Staff are amazing friendly and professional....service superb..and food gorgeous. Breakfast was perfect too. Highly recommend.

name: eddie kent
snippet: Lovely hotel close to the square and railway station.both about 6 minutes walk from the hotel. Leave the car at home and take the train. Easy walk to the many bars and restaurants that Galway has to offer. Staff at this hotel very helpful and great service.

name: Wave Razor
snippet: Rooms were nice, to use the elevator you'd have to insert your room card in the elevator (got a little confused over that) rooms are neat it's being renovated at the moment and there are 2 restaurants on the lobby floor. I liked it, still felt premium even after the renovations

name: Dave Dowling
snippet: Great hotel, great location and helpful staff. We booked an upgrade online through a separate company, I didn't feel that I got and upgrade when I asked to speak to the manager he refunded the update charge and was very apologetic. Will return here again soon.

name: Gerry Harte
snippet: Just returned from spending 2 nights at the Galmont and we had a lovely time.From we checked in until we checked out we were treated with a most courteous and efficient team who are the jewel in the crown for this hotel.Our room and all areas were stick and span and the food was excellent and of a very high quality.The location is excellent as we could walk to the city centre in a matter of minutes so that car was not needed for our duration..Heaven on earth so there is not much more to say except that we will definitely be back.

name: Mitch Sheehy
snippet:
Room was really cold on arrival..went down to the bar for dinner we had to wait for over an hour to get dinner as we were told our order was lost! Offered two free drinks...The meal itself was delicious...home made burger and fries..where we were sitting in the bar lounge was really cold...behind us was a fire escape door which was drafty everyone around us moved over to the far side of the lounge, unfortunately for us all the chairs were taken up...we would have enjoyed a couple of more drinks as it was our wedding anniversary but we were freezing and decided to return to our room. Our room again was freezing had left our room key in the slot beside the door to ensure the power was on in our bedroom.  had the AC turned up to 37c but it did not work...spent the next hour trying to get the AC to work correctly just went to bed with our coats
on so tried...the next morning complained to reception they moved us to another room which had a working AC. We had breakfast each morning which was lovely and a great choice of foods available...did the full spa treatment which was the highlight of our stay... the staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful..just unfortunate that the room we booked had a AC not working and the outside temperature is below freezing....

name: Nadia Mukhar
snippet: Great hotel, very comfortable beds, great service bar and food.  Just don't plan for laundry service pretty expensive.

name: Tom Dunne
snippet:
Staff are not very friendly and  the bar staff are very slow and unaware of customers waiting. I waited for at least 2 minutes during a quiet period to be served while 2 barman wandered the bar with their heads buried in the floor and surrounding shelves. It was only the guy fixing the fridges who made the barman aware l was waiting to be served.
Not on my shift as a bar tender.

name: Andy Pruss
snippet:
Solid option in Galway. A couple dings- Tuesday night the bar was insanely loud very late, only that one night. Even more annoying is that without A/C I had to keep the window open further inviting the noise in. The bar itself was not busy when we visited and all the barstools were cleared out which was weird. I guess they were doing this event

Spa was great, first time trying a thermal room. It's like a sauna with different themes, beach, Turkish bathhouse, rock sauna, aromatherapy.

The one big ding is the gross blood booger on the wall in the bathroom that greated us when we got in our room. We thought the housekeeping team would catch it on the daily room clean but they didn't. It in a very obvious place on a stark whit wall. How they keep missing this I'll never know. My guess is it's still there.

name: Laurence Ryan
snippet: Staff are more than helpful the hotel is well designed with plenty light and the food is good

name: annika
snippet:
Was disappointed with the service, it was a bit hit and miss. The concierge that checked us in, didn't tell us anything about the hotel except what floor our room was on and where the restaurant was for breakfast.

Our first room was dirty and disappointing, when we returned to the check in desk a very nice man (Dermot I think) was helpful and got our room switched after notifying the manager, and even walked us to our room offering to take our bags and to ensure we were happy. The second room was better.

Breakfast was a bit slow, they seemed short of staff, and we tried different times both days. I was sitting next to a man who was telling his associate that he had waited 25 minutes for coffee the previous morning and in the end went to his room to make his own.

There was no real information in the room pack regarding the spa that is supposed to be complimentary in the stay. This was the main reason I paid the extra to stay at the radisson.
After asking concierge information about the spa all they told us was there are lockers and changing rooms in the spa, and there's towels provided. When we turned up at the spa there were two staff manning the desk, we had to ask for assistance after dawdling a minute. We were then informed we needed to wear swimming caps (which was mentioned in the info pack) if we wanted to use the pool. This isn't mentioned on any of the sites when booking the hotel. We were then informed that the swimming hats were to be purchased if you hadn't provided your own and they were €3 each. We were told if we didn't purchase these we could only use the hot tubs and sauna. We had left our belongings in our room since we were heading down to use the pool and I didn't fancy a 15 minute walk to collect €6 so we used the hot tub and left. I was immensely disappointed as we were intending to book in for massages etc since it was our 10 year anniversary.

All in all I think it was one of the most disappointing stays I've ever had and it cost me £250 for the experience. We could have stayed at the local hotel around the corner and felt happier - which ironically is where we spent most of our time. Wouldn't stay again.

name: paul downey
snippet: Beautiful rooms , brilliant location, beside the bus station , would gladly go again

name: Breda Barden
snippet: The only thing the breakfast was  not very hot

name: fiona Galvin
snippet: Beautiful hotel, fantastic beds stunning views, staff were extremely friendly. We had dinner in the restaurant 10 stars just gorgeous can't wait to visit again.

name: Verona Coughlan
snippet: Fabulous hotel, loved our room and the level 5 views worth it for the peace and quiet. Had food in coopers lounge great food, friendly staff all round. Spa was amazing too.

name: David
snippet:
Beautiful hotel in the heart of Galway, very comfortable rooms, great restaurant, and the staff were so helpful. I will definitely stay here again.

Rooms: Comfortable rooms with free WIFI, TV and kettle in each room for tea and coffee

name: Jeri Stiles
snippet: Very very friendly!!! Nice rooms and great breakfast, lunch and dinners.  Easy walk to town.  Would not hesitate to book again!

name: Chris Durden
snippet:
Room was okay. Location was good. Service after check-in pitiful.  Parking was good.

Walkability: Easy access to center city.

name: Joe Darcy
snippet: The Spa would get 5 stars easily. Helpful staff, great facilities and exceptional treatments. Pure relaxation. The hotel however was a disappointment. Every member of staff we came across from reception, bar and restaurant were distant to say the least. Not one of them smiled once. The food was extremely lacklustre. Reasonably priced for a 4 star establishment but I couldn't finish my tasteless shepherd's pie, and I'm not a fussy eater. My partner didn't finish his chowder either. Many better chowders out there in the pubs of Galway. We ordered an extra side of mac and cheese to try to fill up but that too was disappointing. Fruit salad for breakfast was lovely but the cooked breakfast my partner had was dried and eggs not nice. Bed was absolutely amazing, the quilt, mattress and pillows made for the dreamiest night's sleep I've had in a long time. All other features of the room were outdated, worn or misplaced. Have used the spa in the past and will return many times again.

name: Steve Hartmann
snippet: We stayed at the hotel for a night with a room facing the reception entrance. What they did not tell us was that an event was taking place at the night and our room would fully hear, feel and see the party until 3am. Calling the reception several times led to nothing except the staff being rude to us for complaining about the noise. Never again

name: Barry Kehoe
snippet: A nice room more than friendly and helpful staff but a very peculiar design of hotel. We had to take a very long and circuitous route from the lobby to our room. It is pretty central and the city centre is a handy 6-10 min walk away.

name: Lynne Cole
snippet: Lovely clean rooms,Breakfast was a diaster the way its done and yet there was lots of staff but not helpful or maybe not trained well.

name: Michelle Thompson
snippet: Hotel its self is lovely and the staff are very helpful. Food is yummy. The only thing I was very disappointed with was the room. Bed was nice but the room itself was tatty. Paint chips gone out of the wall etc.

name: Shawn Thibeault
snippet:
Had an unfriendly front desk reception from Dawid...grumpy!!  He also gave us a room that over looked the top of the roof even though we expressed this was our first visit to Ireland and would pay more for a better view...laughed and said oh ok.
The rooms were dirty...finger prints all over the water/wine glasses & mirrors, gross tea kettle with food inside, only decaf available, mold all around shower/tub, NO sheets under the comforter, gym was dirty with dirty sweat on most equipment.  Giving it 2 stars just because it's better than a hostel and it's location...close to shops/restaurants which where all great!

name: Louise Coyle
snippet: Booked a superior room. Very disappointed with the size of the room. The room view is looking out on concrete buildings and the bathroom is very outdated. The quality of the room does not reflect the price we paid. Will not be returning again

name: Lauren Fleming
snippet: Not good you guys! We waited for an hour and a half after check in for our room to be ready - the room was still not ready so we had to leave as we had plans and tables booked etc. We left our bags with concierge and had to get ourselves ready to go out in the PUBLIC TOILETS of the hotel. So our plans got cancelled pretty swiftly as we couldn't shower etc. We got back to the hotel and were put in a room that was so noisy (it overlooked the terrace of the bar) that we didn't sleep. It was our first time in Galway in a very long time and because of the Galmont it was ruined to be quite honest. I can't even begin to tell you guys how dissappointed I am right now. Waste of time, money and effort. STAY AWAY!!! There are plenty of other hotels in Galway that would appreciate your custom - the Galmont does  not.

name: Ciara Flynn
snippet:
Fabulous hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean rooms. Big breakfast available.

Lovely gym and pool. Always clean. Glad I joined as a member.

name: Judy Aguilar
snippet: Very nice hotel. Will stay again. Will probably get a much needed massage because my feet and legs are sore from walking all day.

name: Edith Odoherty
snippet: No Atmosphere and Restaurant Food incredibly poor. First Hotel I ever stayed that the bottle of wine was left on table , not poured and not asked to taste. Shocking Service. like a canteen , no tablecloths on tables

name: Geraldine McVeigh
snippet: My husband son and myself spent 3nights here over Christmas second year in a row we had a lovely time hotel is spotless very nicely decorated for Christmas and very central the food is amazing especially the Christmas Day lunch the staff are fantastic very pleasant and helpful we witnessed a lovely act of kindness on Christmas Day (lunch time) by a member of staff to an elderly couple the lady seemed to have had a stroke and couldn’t feed herself the male member of staff assisted her with feeding so her husband could have his lunch he was very patient and courteous and this was at there busy time well done to everybody

name: mark perry
snippet:
Galway's hidden gem of a hotel, for quality friendly service, quality delicious food and plenty available and selection at the breakfast buffet, spacious rooms , plenty of parking underground at a fair price.
I was at the Mayor's Ball in the main hall.
The night was well organized ,well timed with each act during dinner service.
Absolute professionals, the ball was one of the best nights I have had in many years.
Fundraising for deserving societies.
And to top it all the Stunning a Galway band received a well deserved  award.
Hats off to the organisers / production company.
While in the background the Galmont staff were making sure everyone in the hotel were
Given the best service, with genuine pleasantries. A big thank you from me and our guests .

name: Elaine Naughton
snippet: Visit the spa here a couple of times a year with my friend. On our last visit it was under renovations. Not a big deal. However, despite the fact I was told when we booked that they were "fully booked" and couldn't get a treatment for the same time as my friend... we were the only people there!?! I spent the time in the Thermal suite instead..which I had to myself... Disappointed not to get a treatment when meanwhile 3 staff stood around looking bored at spa reception.....???

name: ritika perti
snippet:
Great tidy rooms. Beautiful view from the 4th floor.
The service could have been better but that might have been due to new years.
All in all. Would like to stay at the galmont again!

name: Ana Carolina C. Alves
snippet: Very cleaned, food is amazing. A good place to stay in Galway, really closer to the train/bus station.

name: Gurmukh Neote
snippet: Luxury stay walking distance to Eyre Square in Galway City. The staff are very friendly, all covid measures are visible and make you feel safe. The spa is worth a visit too. They have many treatments and great to relax in the Thermal Suite after which you need to book in advance

name: Anton Sweeney
snippet:
This is unfortunately a three-star hotel masquerading as a four-star.  It's clean, bright, airy and spacious, but the service was somewhat lacking.

Rooms: we had a family room - >king size bed and large twin beds. There were only round (European? American?) sockets on the bed side of the room (anyone with a sleep apnoea machine or wanting their phone nearby charging overnight would be screwed).  Other side of room had two normal sockets - not enough for the two electric room heaters (needed!), floor lamps, minifridge, desk lamp, kettle - or things like our 4 phones and tablet...

Bar: Went to the hotel bar while waiting to check in (you can't check in until 4pm). Was told they didn't serve food there (it was the only place with a TV and I wanted to watch the France v Ireland 6 Nations game).  At half-time, ran over to the restaurant where one person told me they couldn't bring food over to the bar; another told me of course they could (and she did).  Better communication (and customer service!) needed.  Bar counter was wet with spilled drink - only those waxy paper beermats available rather than actually absorbent ones. Nobody wiped down the bar counter while I was there.

Family had lunch in the restaurant, I got a sandwich delivered to bar - food was ok, nothing great.

Bar had usual Diageo brands, and local Galway Hooker Pale Ale on tap.

Breakfast is self-service buffet; unfortunately not many staff on, saw fried eggs were dry/congealed, other cooked food was lukewarm at best; waited 20 minutes for clean glasses to be brought out for juice.  Disappointing, as a good 'full Irish' is one of life's treats when on holiday or a break.

Sunday night, Valentine's night, we were told they stopped serving cocktails at 11:30...

Parking charge of €5/day which is cheap, but obviously doesn't show up in room rate when comparing room prices.  And to be honest, a hotel charging guests to park is just penny-pinching meanness.

name: Arthur Lesser
snippet:
We had some initial problems and concerns that management addressed immediately.  I would stay there again.

Food & drinks: Great Food and service

Noteworthy details: Near airport

name: Patrick O'Halloran
snippet: This used to be the Radisson Hotel and used to be very nice.  I checked in for one night & was put out in the "East Wing" they call it. It's basically the non updated part of the hotel that's in poor condition and very far from everything. They didn't seem to be many rooms booked in that part of the hotel but luckily they stuck us next to some extremely noisey people & of course the walls are paper thin. Did I mention the food? I ordered soup and I'm not sure what flavor it was except a strange tan color and bland as hell. All in all I say stay away & wait til the new owners figure out what customer service is!!

name: Fateema Bawarish
snippet:
My dad had a  stressful and  very disapionting stay in tge hotel in june this year  he arrived at 4 o'clock pm and the room was not ready he  had to wait for over half an hour which caused him significant delay attending a function that evening  . he had made over 2 weeks in advance getting quite floor.He  had made repeatedly to the resevration staff requesting quite room on top floor to his disappionment he was given a niosy room on the first floor and he tried many times with the hotel staff to change the rooma and it was cometely usuuccesful and in fact they were totaaly not interested and they had a careless attatude toward customers interest . definatly not recommended

This is the view of my dad when he went .

name: Muireann Toibin
snippet: Lovely hotel, gentle staff and super bed.  Food was delicious, beautifully cooked and delicious veggie options.  Leisure centre was an additional luxury after a busy day.

name: Kris Cunningham
snippet: The galmont was easy to find with underground parking at a very good discounted rate for hotel guests (€8), upon arrival we were given a room without a bath  a quick call to reception and we were soon moved to a new room, in the older part of the hotel above the gym although you could here the music playing below this didn't overly annoy us. The room was adequate with a comfortable bed and all the modern facilities you would expect. The location is a superb 5 mins walk from central Galway. The choice at breakfast was very good with plenty of options both cold and hot.The galmont is a large modern hotel form the decor to the seemingly robotic staff who while doing nothing wrong just seemed to be going through the motions. If you're simply after a bed and good location the galmont is fine, it just lacks the wow factor for a truly memorable stay. I would not stay here again as there plenty of other options to consider in Galway city.

name: Stuart Masterson
snippet: Overall great hotel. The staff always willing to help, don't think they know the word no. The bar has just been refurbished. There is also a spa, pool and gym. I haven't used any of them so can't comment

name: Cathy Miskella
snippet: Stayed for 3 nights from 14 th oct to 17th oct, the rooms very clean and staff excellent and very friendly. Breakfast in the morning was very disappointing we were up early so the food should have been warm but everything was lukewarm and not very appetising, we decided not to eat any of the so called hot breakfast after first morning and just settled for cold meats and cheese. Don't think I would stay there again.

name: C CR
snippet: Had a great trip to Galway made even better by the Galmont Hotel. It's in a great location with some good views.

name: Brian Mcentee
snippet: The service in the hotel was amazing the staff was so friendly and helpful, the room was big enough nice view , the only issue I had was the breakfast was not nice at all and some cups or forks I got weren’t clean they had the forks in a package where you couldn’t open it but there was still a bit of food stuck to the fork ... everything else was perfect the hotel is only a 3 minute walk or less into the city and right beside the train station ... I’m giving the 4 stars because the staff were amazing fair play customer service is phenomenal !!!

name: Niklas Thomsen
snippet: Had such beautiful time in the hotel. Nice beds, breakfast and spa experience! Would definitely come back.

name: F Mclean
snippet: Excellent location short walk from train station.All staff were professional and well focused to needs of residents.would definitely visit again.The buzz in the City only a few minutes away was a welcome back to normal times returning.

name: Jason Wieczorek
snippet: Disappointing hotel as the pictures of the room online, didn't match the room I was given. Especially the bathroom, which after talking to hotel staff they said was only in Executive rooms. Well then why would you describe that as a standard bathroom? They couldn't change my room either, and I ended up leaving for another local hotel as I didn't feel I was getting my money's worth.

name: Rich Moore
snippet: Nice hotel with all the necessary upgrades.  Great food on site and a short walk to all the fun of downtown Galway.

name: Paul Egan
snippet: Hotel was nice, staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was heated by two plug in radiators. The lift system is a lottery of what floor or direction it is going to go in, as a result it is slow. Also parking is extra.

name: chad hendricks
snippet: The entire hotel was amazing. The Marina restaurant inside the hotel was especially spectacular. Vincent, our server both nights, provided my wife and I with the best dining experience of our lives.

name: Alexandra Panasiuk
snippet:
This was the worst hotel stay of my life!!
The first night I was bit two times by a bed bug. When I went downstairs in the morning to change to the room, I was not received with empathy. The lady at the front desk said that my bite looks like a mosquito bite even though I explained to her previously that I eliminated that option already. I was able to determined that my bites look just like the bed bug bites through google.
I was able to change the room with no further issues, but I have not received any apologies or additional information about this insistence. This was extremely disappointing and I will never stay at this hotel again.

name: Paul
snippet: Very loud base and sound  coming from a party downstairs until very early a.m.. Shocking pints in the hotel, the Guinness was like something out of a horror movie (the guy that served  me didn't even give it chance to settle).Hotel bar lacked attention such as cleaning the fridge doors etc. Kettle in my room didn't work! Nice rooms with comfy beds! Very clean however door aricitraving could badly do with replacement as old and shabby! Great location! Tight parking underground which you have to pay extra for!! Bouncers required outside as a few rough druggies in tracksuits and runners allowed in to mix with the Christmas Partys

name: Michael Smith
snippet: Could not sleep, very loud music from the bar/restaurant shaking the room until past midnight, will not come back

name: Jason Sheehan
snippet: Just stayed in this hotel with my partner and I and we both loved everything about it....the rooms were great size great views the spa and pool unbelievable to b honest....and the the staff were so helpfull and smiled all the time and made us feel so welcome....so thanks great hotel

name: John Maher
snippet: Stopped in for some fancy lunch, theres a limited menu on offer but what we got was tasty. Service was prompt and efficient.

name: David Wolfson
snippet: Excellent room size. Very comfortable bed. Great location.  Very good food both dinner and breakfast.  Very attentive to dietary needs.  Nice lounge with good music

name: Pat Folan
snippet: I graduated here in 2020 with an MSc. I can vouch for their event hosting and overall decor and staff but I didn't stay in a room

name: Declan Drumm
snippet: Very disappointing the room was dirty cup stains on the lockers dust on the tv the shower would not work right there was skid marks still on the toilet bowl and hairs in the bath. At breakfast time I had to spend 10 minutes looking for a clean plate and that was enough to put the hunger of me. 600 Euro for 2 nights and another 16 Euro far parking was the icing on the cake it doesn’t even deserve one star. B&bs in Ireland are miles ahead of these so called 4 star hotels.

name: Jazmine Frey
snippet: Staff were lovely and so helpful. Food and drinks were amazing, best cocktails! Room was really nice and comfortable. I didn't want to leave.

name: Jim Leary
snippet: Our 'go to' place to stay in Galway. Great location, very convenient to train/bus station.  Excellent service and facilities.

name: Mathew Preece
snippet: Standard issue hotel in good location for Galway. Beware, there is no policy to end functions at midnight. So if you get a room above the bar don't expect to get much sleep.

name: Samuel Coleman
snippet: Hotel reception and restaurant were very nice ....but for 240 a night the room wasn’t the best also had to pay 9 euro for parking for one night and got two bottles of water sent to the room which we ended up having to pay €14 for ...wouldn’t go back again

name: Dylan Crampton
snippet: 4 check in is ridiculous, rooms are lovely and comfy beds, room was cleaned even tho I left a no entry on the door which is weird, would stay again if it wasn’t as pricey

name: Megg Beverage
snippet:
Beautiful hotel! A view of the bay in dun loughaire that was fabulous.

Walkability: Easy walk to restaurants, shops and the Irish sea.

Food & drinks: The food was excellent and Guinness tastes better in Ireland

name: Mary Connolly
snippet:
The staff in the spa were very nice and friendly.
The hotel was nice and comfortable , we were waiting three quaters of an hour for  bar food to be served, when I asked for the bill , it was brought to me straight away

name: bernadette hynes
snippet: Amazing hotel, friendly staff. Breakfast was really nice. Food was lovely in the restaurant and you are only around the corner from Eyre Square

name: AP
snippet: Very poor quality food.  A 3 star hotel at the most.  Really declined in recent years.  Avoid

name: Robert Fitzgerald
snippet: Hotel is fine but what I don't understand is for a "five" star hotel in which you pay top dollar prices. You don't even get complimentary car parking. I've never known a hotel to charge guests for parking. Scandalous

name: Amy R
snippet: Stayed there in December. Fabulous stay   Great location walking distance to restaurants and pubs.

name: Bernie O'Shaughnessy
snippet: Great hotel. Cooked breakfast not great. Breakfast staff very grumpy. Bar staff great very chatty. House keeping great. Having to pay for parking is not great. Very close to town.

name: Mary McStay
snippet: Amazing weekend experience,loved the hotel, staff very helpful, food and wine delicious, bedroom very comfortable, I'll definitely be back again

name: Rick Jenkins
snippet: Every was good except the restaurant food. Had to send a chuy steak back and the  chicken was over cooked. They did apologied, refunded and provided a better steak.

name: Deirdre Lynn
snippet: Fabulous spa, thoroughly enjoyed the thermal suite and the treatments afterwards. Had a beautiful lunch afterwards. Would definitely recommend this for a day out ☺️

name: Brian Ryan
snippet: Have stayed at the radisson a few times now.. within 5 mins walk from Eyre Square shops, bars and restaurants all locally accessible.. The hotel itself is amazing, great stuff.. great food and comfortable bar area. also a nice balcony view of the city

name: Molly Burns
snippet: Awesome! Just caught by an unpleasant surprise when we were greeted after a red-eye flight by the rude American front desk attendee - who felt the need to insult the intelligence and eye-sight of my aging parents. Most likely from either NY, PA, or NJ, each day he stared down at the computer, never acknowledging the groups of guests as they enter the lobby.. It's not just the disappointment that he's not the friendly person I expected. It's just -  I try so much so they don't think they're old. If you work in hospitality, why talk so condescendingly to guests? That's the family's job.

name: Amber Galindo
snippet: Rooms are great. Breakfast was delightful. Easy on site parking.

name: Madhuri Baldewa
snippet: Beautiful view from the room and good hospitality. They have wide range for Breakfast Buffet suitable for vegetarian.

name: Richard flood
snippet:
great hotel
great location

only issue was bill you 9.00 a night  for car after pay 420.oo for two nights + couple hundred spending in bar on food and drinks.

but fully enjoyed our stay ...

name: Razor Ruddock
snippet: Peter our cocktail master went above & beyond at our cocktail making class as part of our recent hen party experience. He’s was both fun and ultra professional and I have to say a great asset to the hotel.

name: Elaine Hetherston
snippet: We had a fabulous weekend here for my sisters 40th birthday, the hotel staff were amazing, food and atmosphere was perfect, we will definitely be back

name: Ray Randal
snippet: Lovely spa and pool facilities that hotel guests get to enjoy. Good location in Galway

name: Courtnie Lambert
snippet: The hotel was very modern and clean. Had a great breakfast with beautiful views of the river and only a short walk to the square and shop street. Only downside is that you have to pay for parking.

name: Kweeveen Campbell
snippet: Gorgeous Hotel,kind,friendly and efficient staff,delicious food,fantastic location,ideal for a short or long stay in Galway and great value for    money,

name: Kieran Thompson
snippet: Lovely modern and clean hotel close to local bars. Staff went out there way to help when i had an accident getting candle wax on a shirt and had it cleaned within the hour. Would highly recomend and will defo stay again next time im in galway

name: Julian Kamau-Tillotson
snippet: Great staff treat the driver like a real person. Thanks guys alway a pleasure to see your name on itinerary j k t

name: Caoimhe Forde
snippet: Just back from my fabulous day at the spirit one spa and got a god like facial from Emily who was so kind and made me feel super relaxed! Will definitely be returning soon.

name: Patricia Coen
snippet: The Hotel is really nice. My only problem was that I couldnt have a brandy and port in the bar as there wasnt any port. The service in the bar left a lot to be desired. Otherwise it was a lovely visit

name: Jim Dolan
snippet: Excellent hotel everything from start of stay to finish was first class staff were very attentive  and polite will defiantly be back only a five minute walk to town centre  the girl manager from donegal was so informative 5 star for me

name: Oliver Springer
snippet: The heater was broken in my room. Breakfast was good. Decent location close to the train station

name: Becky Howe
snippet: Fantastic! Service excellent, room stunning, bathrooms luxurious, the thermae spa was heavenly, restaurant food lovely and to top it off they had a live pianist for entertainment Friday and Saturday nights who was incredible.

name: S B
snippet: Beautiful hotel, very nice, quiet, well taken care of. The servers in the restaurant were a bit cold and forgetful towards us, but the food was good, and the drinks were cold.

name: Carmel Cosgrove
snippet: Fab hotel ideally situated for shops pubs and restaurants  highly recommend this hotel.

name: Patricia Kavanagh
snippet: Excellent hotel. Beds comfy. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast fresh and tasty.  Highly recommend!

name: michael murray
snippet: Lovely hotel. Great food. Clean rooms and nice pool. We will return again.

name: Graham Lay
snippet: Nice rooms, and staff. Restaurant menu a little permanent. Good bar. Local to the town. Easy walk to Galway restaurants. Recommended

name: hydar abu shareef
snippet: Overpriced almost 500euros for two nights. The AC was barely a fan. The location is very good few mins from train station

name: Paolo C
snippet: Giant cosy beds. Great blackout curtains. Outdoor hot tub is a lovely touch. Breakfast was good.

name: Shirley Stirzaker
snippet:
Excellent customer service
Very clean bar staff are incredibly helpful
Spa was wonderful again staff were so nice and helpful. Really enjoyed our stay

name: James Richardson
snippet: Friendly staff - delicious nibbles - diverse entertainment: mainly the band but with guests in their best dresses for the Galway Races dancing away to the music, you couldn't help but smile!

name: Mark Keane
snippet: Superb rooms and spacious.  A most enjoyable Stay.

name: Gerard Brady
snippet: Stay here anytime I'm in Galway . Close to center . Great bar and dining. Multistory carpark and spa/pool on site . Clean , modern and cosy.  Very friendly staff .

name: Paul McCormack
snippet: Not good - a 3 day hike to a room in the west part of the hotel. Opaque windows -  claustrophobic and not the cleanest

name: Frances Lynch
snippet: Great hotel. Nice facilities. Easy walk to city centre. Great choice of breakfast. Friendly staff

name: Mick Mccabe
snippet: Great hotel clean friendly nice rooms great food bar has great atmosphere

name: Harsh Thareja
snippet: View was nice, but the room (superior king) was not that big enough as it seemed in the pictures. Also, the towels in the washroom had some kind of a smell.

name: costellogus
snippet: Nice clean hotel we had a dinner in the bar Cooper's a lovely girl Caitlin more than helpful hope to return great location

name: kathy pfeifle
snippet: Clean large rooms, king suite was very comfortable. Great breakfast buffet to start the day. Good service.

name: Sean Kearney
snippet: All good nice place very clean and tidy very good staff very helpful friendly I'll be back.

name: Alain Johnstone
snippet: Huge party in the hall on the weekend at night. You can feel the bass in your room until 2:00am so stay at the bar or join the party, but don't try to sleep.

name: Sheila Murphy
snippet: We had a great weekend here, location was perfect, staff were great and the hotel was buzzing

name: rory bohan
snippet: I was at the bar... Unfortunately the prices were 5 star but the service was 1

name: Richard Casserly
snippet: Very enjoyable experience whether eating, drinking joining the gym and pool or whether enjoying a day in the spa. Service is professional and kind and experience is great.

name: Tom Hanley
snippet:
Visited during Galway Races. Very busy. Last year
Bar service very very slow, no improvement in a year.
However, it is Race week in Galway.

name: John Ward
snippet:
Really lovely staff... Food fantastic... Beautiful room... Great Cocktails... Everything
100%....

name: Tina M.
snippet: Nice hotel, well located as you can easily walk in the city centre. Very helpful and friendly staff. Sometimes a bit too busy.

name: Janet Cleary
snippet: Lovely hotel, delicious food, very central, five minute walk to Galway city centre. Drinking water amenities on every corridor

name: Angela Stokes
snippet: Lovely hotel very centrally located close to everything Galway has to offer coupled with excellent safety standards in line with Government recommendations on COVID 19

name: Ashley D.
snippet: Beautiful spa uptown in Galway, the staff is so friendly and accommodating. I had the Cleopatra Milk Bath Treatment, and it was relaxing and hydrating after I got off the flight.

name: Tauseef Khan
snippet: Beautiful location. Friendly staff. Good breakfast.

name: David Mcbreen
snippet: I only had to use the toilet but if there anything to go by,well I wouldn't mind staying there.spotless and the reception area very spacious and great view with the glass front.

name: Joe Zaza
snippet: Very nice hotel and staff, nice dining and bar area. Easy walk to the main street area for pubs and music. Decent shower.

name: Jameson MacGregor
snippet: We stay here every time we are in Galway. The food and bar are great, and the morning buffet is one NOT to miss

name: Erdem Sagdiç
snippet:
Very good accommodation
Room is very clean
Service is very nice
Personal is very kindly

name: Nicole Osborne
snippet: Amazing stay. Everything was extremely clean and sanitised. Really nice food and cocktails and the room view was gorgeous

name: Darragh Toner
snippet:
Nice place. Expensive but really comfy bed.
Parking charge shouldn’t apply to guests staying and paying up to €300 per night.

name: Bruce Watson
snippet: Great location, 10 minute walk from the centre of Galway. Good breakfast and a decent bar. Average hotel rooms.

name: Imelda Connolly
snippet: Did not stay there Disappointed with the charge for car park 15euros Went to concert there Should be no charge for that

name: Kathy Scanlan
snippet: Beautiful hotel, lovely helpful staff, spacious room, huge bed. Would definitely recommend a stay here.

name: Mary Trainor
snippet:
Excellent desserts. Great choice of teas and coffee
Staff as always attentive and friendly.
The afternoon tea looks amazing

name: Benette van Dyk
snippet:
Newly refurbished rooms with an excellent breakfast. Pizza was excellent.

Rooms: Newly refurbished

Walkability: Close to the Latin Quarter

Food & drinks: Excellent breakfast

name: Sandra Keatley
snippet: Hotel great and location wonderful    Breakfast really good not impressed by set menu with package deal

name: James Larkin
snippet: Highly recommended... proper covid safe environment. Good food and proper friendly service. Great music ... social distancing    10 out of 10 . Great staycation

name: Adi Ulman
snippet: Great food and facilities. The staff could be nicer. The room was nice and comfortable.

name: Leticia Agudo
snippet: Didn't stay here, was just here for meetings, coffee drinks, in their lounge, bar and terrace. Lovely spaces, hotel prices, nice staff.

name: Paul Walsh
snippet: Nice bar and breakfast....big pool too

name: Dermot Clancy
snippet: Great hotel. Great location in the city. Jus toff the main square. Lovely bright rooms.

name: oisin oconnor
snippet: Lovely hotel awesome breakfast and the staff couldn't do enough for you this was my second visit and I'll definitely be back

name: Dror Fries
snippet: Great tiramisu. I personally didnt like the pizza. Ate better ones. Probably stick to other dishes

name: James Core
snippet: Excellent place to sit and enjoy food and drinks while looking out over the sea side . Service was excellent and they are very clean and safe .

name: Mary Kearns
snippet: Lovely hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. Great breakfast!

name: Gloria Tahhan
snippet: Clean hotel. Our telephone and hairdryer did not work and were not replaced.

name: Bernard Kelly
snippet: One of the best hotels in Galway. Rooms & food are incredible. Staff are great!

name: Mark Sole
snippet: A great value, newly renovated rooms, GREAT location, cozy bar and restaurant and warm staff

name: Mandy Winters
snippet: Nice hotel but very much lacking in good staff. Often understaffed. Be prepared to wait.

name: Paul Mahon (Geppetto)
snippet: Was there for a fashion event so it was perfect. Large open spaces, clean and tiny, lovely spot of a coffee and relax or work on your laptop etc.

name: EJ Fallon
snippet: Lovely hotel, rooms and an incredible spa. We had massage and really enjoyed the water suite.

name: Margaret maher
snippet: Lovely friendly hotel, staff were lovely, the rooms were beautiful,  spotlessly clean, would highly recommend the Galmont hotel

name: Hanna Soina (SAN)
snippet: Nice place to stay and relax, I would come back

name: Karl Phillips
snippet: Great hotel,  room was really good,  buffet breakfast good and you are next to Eyre Square would recommend

name: Pat Surlis
snippet: Theres a great little City Centre Gym attached to this hotel. Very convenient.  Full gym, Spa, Sauna etc and pool.

name: Sirju Patel
snippet: No air-condition and a very far walk to the room with 2 elevators, other wise very nice hotel. Service and room we're nice.

name: Debra Stone
snippet: Modern, clean hotel with friendly staff.  Took can to hop on and off trolley to sight see and get around town.

name: Kay Monahan
snippet: The Galmont is a lovely place to stay the staff are first class as are rooms I requested a room with a walk in shower which they accommodated with no problems at all i had the short rib of beef with veg for dinner  which was perfect and again service impeccable  Thankyou

name: Deirdre Beecher
snippet: Whenever I'm in Galway I always make sure I have time to visit the spa.  It has the best hamman of any hotel I've been in.

name: Jonny Bell
snippet: Really comfortable hotel and nice food the breakfast was nice even for a buffet. I would stay again

name: Keith Boyd
snippet: Great staff, very helpful and reactive. Food was lovely and the area in general is fantastic.

name: Tom jesson
snippet: Great  place to stay,   food was lovely   breakfast  very well organised.

name: Yousef Alhaji
snippet: amazing 4 star hotel with facilities of 5 star  the rate was good for its facilities breakfast was lovely  full of foods the staff are professional  helping whatever u ask high recommended to stay on this hotel

name: Sam Banzhaf
snippet: Lovely staff and good location, easily walkable to pubs and restaurants. Nice, clean rooms.

name: Stephanie O' Toole
snippet: Had a brilliant massage here before and a not so good one. All in all fabulous place, great ambiance and staff are lovely.

name: Jackie Godfrey
snippet: Fantastic time in the hotel . Staff all very helpful and atmosphere in hotel excellent. Will definitely be back.

name: Daven Healy
snippet: Rooms were nice. Food was lovely. Very central, just a two minute walk to Eyre Square.

name: Michael
snippet:
Lovely hotel in a great location.

It's within a 5 minute walk of Eyre Square, coach station and train station.

name: Christine Walton
snippet: 2lifts from reception followed by 200 strides to get to the lift on the 1st floor to take you to the 2nd and 3rd floors. The view from my room was a wall and a fence and rooftops.

name: gerard scott

snippet: J’ai pris mon petit déjeuner d’anniversaire dans cet hôtel je souhaite remercier  Clodagh pour son accueil. Un merci tout particulier à Jordi qui m’a préparer de super pancake d’anniversaire. Merci également à sa collègue Dagmara d’avoir chanter avec lui pour mon anniversaire. Tout était parfait et leur service irréprochable. J’ai passé un super moment.

name: Valeria Larrouturou
snippet:
Nous avons passé une nuit dans cet hôtel en octobre.
L'hôtesse à la réception super efficace agréable et s'adaptant à notre anglais moyen. La chambre était spacieuse et la literie top, on a dormi comme des bébés.
L'hôtel est très joli, idéalement situé vous êtes au centre en 5 minutes à pieds.
Le petit déjeuner très bien, varié et les pancakes sur commande très bons!
Peut être le seul point négatif le prix du parking, fallait bien trouver quelque chose.
Si nous revenons à Galway, j'espère pouvoir me relonger ici.
Merci pour tout!

name: Léa Pacuta
snippet: Hôtel très bien situé (5min à pied du centre). Lit très grand et confortable, petit déjeuner sous forme de buffet avec beaucoup de choix (et option pour vegan et sans gluten). L'hôtel est très beau, très bien décoré en cette période de Noël. Excellent rapport qualité/prix !

name: Patrick Herbert
snippet: Chambre très spacieuse , dommage que la salle de bain ne soit pas à la hauteur , parking tout proche ainsi que le centre ville . Piscine oui mais prévoir le bonnet de bain , on a jamais cela en voyageant !! Donc pas de piscine

snippet: Вид з конференц залу 4 поверху просто дивовижний! Отель має гарну парковку, чудово розташований поряд з центром і вокзалом, і ідеально підходить для конференцій

snippet: Très bel hôtel, il manque pas grand choses pour que ça soit parfait. Genre des prises USB  dans les chambres

snippet: Gutes Hotel an einer ruhigen guter Lage. 15 min vom Zentrum entfernt. Zimmer sauber und WLAN.  Einzig unsere Dame an der Rezeption war nicht gerade nett. Sie hat uns etwas barsch die sachen gefragt und sich offensichtlich über uns genervt da wir sie nicht verstehen konnten.  Frühstück war gut hat alles was man braucht.

name: Remy Rosset
snippet:
Après une semaine d’itinérance à vélo autour du Connemara, nous avions dans l’idée de nous reposer une nuit à Galway dans le confort d’un hôtel 4 étoiles.
Nous avions réservé une chambre dite classique sans tenir compte qu’elle ne proposait pas de climatisation.
Grave erreur!
Nous voici parqués dans l’aile est avec vu sur le parking dans une chambre non climatisée, très exposée au soleil (oui il fait chaud en Irlande!) sans possibilité d’ouvrir la fenêtre plus d’un travers de main… Nous n’avons pas dormi de la nuit et étions plus fatigués après une nuit au Galmont qu’après nos 100km à vélo quotidien autour du Connemara. A PROSCRIRE absolument!!!
Je ne parle même pas du prix pratiqué, exorbitant, pour ne pas obtenir le minimum attendu d’un hôtel : une bonne nuit de sommeil!

name: Raquel Huete
snippet:
Muy recomendable. La habitación era espaciosa y cómoda. En recepción trabaja un joven de Ontenyent muy amable.
El desayuno buffet es buenísimo.

name: Thomas Weiss
snippet: Solides Hotel. Wir waren drei Nächte hier. Gute Lage um die Stadt zu erkunden. Essen ist super!

name: Sarah R.
snippet:
Sehr gutes Hotel. Das Personal war sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit (einziger Minuspunkt war das man uns bei der Ankunft zweimal verwiesen hatte, da unser Zimmer noch nicht fertig war, obwohl wir bereits nach der Check-In Zeit da waren).
Das Zimmer war groß und mit Blick auf den Fluss. Badezimmer war nicht übermäßig groß, aber ausreichend.
Das Frühstücksbuffet war ausreichend groß, es gab sowohl Süßes, als auch Pikantes. Der Kaffee war jedoch (meiner Meinung nach) grauenvoll.

snippet:

Die Zimmer waren schön, allerdings hellhörig und mit Duschvorhang (warum kein Glas?).
Frühstück war guter Durchschnitt.

name: Resize Smith
snippet:
Facile d'accès, grand parking (payant), et idéal pour visiter Galway. Même avec plein de séminaires dans l'hôtel, nous nous sommes sentis à l'aise.

Accueil très sympa, chambre très grande et propre, petit-déjeuner complet.

Bar très sympa pour boire un verre le soir et manger un petit snack. Nous avons également testé le spa, très agréable avec des massages au top.

Petit bémol sur l'Executive Room, qui était une fois fermée, ou plus réapprovisionnée, mais sympa pour boire un verre au calme.

Après, la nuit au 5e étage est à 265€, non négligeable.

name: Thomas Tu
snippet:
一進到飯店大廳，check in 的服務非常的友善，說明非常仔細。
今天很熱鬧，大廳酒吧非常熱鬧，很多人在看球賽喝酒。
房間很典雅乾淨，窗外的風景非常開闊。
會再次拜訪

snippet: War für 2 Nächte dort. Die Mitarbeiter waren freundlich. Das Zimmer war sauber und wurde auch sehr gut geputzt und wieder hergerichtet. Die Lage ist relativ zentral, sprich man ist in 10min in der Innenstadt und in 4min am Busbahnhof / Bahnhof.

Vom Essen Her kann och nicht klagen, ein Anständiges Frühstücksbuffet und Abends eine Anständige Karte.
Da es Nahe an der Innenstadt liegt ist man schnell überall

snippet: Estuvimos alojados en los apartamentos y son simplemente geniales! Dos plantas, cocina equipada, dos baños y un aseo, salón y dos habitaciones. Una decoración exquisita, nuevo, limpio y bien cuidado! Y el trato con el gerente fue inmejorable! Muy recomendable

name: Ivan Pasqualini
snippet:
Camera troppo calda. I soliti cuscini di piuma  che si appiattiscono non hanno aiutato a dormire.
Mi sono fatto portare la cena in camera. Il mio vassoio è rimasto nel corridoio dopo consumato per 2 giorni.
Inoltre hanno fatto suonare l'allarme antincendio nel pieno della notte per ben 3 volte. Da spaccare le orecchie. Non si capiva che cosa si doveva fare. Un incubo.

Le 2 stelle solo per la buona cucina.

name: Michael Hack
snippet: Wir hatten im Vorfeld über einen Reiseveranstalter gebucht, leider gab es dabei ein Kommunikationsproblem. So wurde unsere Tochter (12 Jahre) nicht angegeben. Das Zimmer, das wir hatten, war laut Webseite NICHT für ein Zustellbett geeignet. Nach einem Anruf im Hotel sagte man uns jedoch, dass dies überhaupt kein Problem sei. Als wir ankamen, haben wir gesehen, dass das Hotel quasi das Zimmer umgebaut hat, um doch noch ein Zustellbett hinein zu stellen. Das Frühstück, dass für 2 Erwachsene inkludiert war, wurde dabei ebenfalls nicht berechnet, obwohl ich es problemlos bezahlt hätte!

name: Daniel Ortega
snippet:
Horrible, gente española que veáis este comentario por favor de verdad no vayáis.
El spa es una estafa el jacuzzi exterior estaba con el agua congelada y el spa interior no se le puede llamar ni spa además con agua bastante fria...
Ya si hablo de la habitación, nos pusieron en un cuarto donde se escuchaba todas las ventilaciones del hotel nos tocó cambiarnos de habitación a las 2 de la mañana y el la habitación donde nos recolocaron no funcionaba la calefacción y hacia un frío de mil demonios... Encima nos dicen tenéis vistas al mar abrimos la ventana y eran vistas al parking se supone que esa habitación sería más cara que la que hemos cogido.... La nuestra 170€ la noche!!! Y al día siguiente al poner la reclamación nada no existe y ni perdón nos dieron simplemente un 25% de descuento se rieron en nuestra cara... Si podéis evitarlo... Además está justo a lado de un centro para vagabundos que en principio ningún problema, el problema llego cuando se pusieron dos sin hogar drogados hasta las trancas a gritarnos... Total una mala experiencia en este hotel y el precio un robo a mano armada...

name: Niara Tolentino
snippet: O hotel é simplesmente incrível. Quarto e cama grandes e super confortáveis. Localização ótima, super próximo do centrinho e ainda da pra aproveitar bastante a piscina e o jacuzzi.
